entries.name: Special
entries: You may not benefit from the rogue's Sneak Attack feature while using this weapon two-handed. This weapon can be chosen as a kensei weapon.

entries.name: Special
entries: You may not benefit from the rogue's Sneak Attack feature while using this weapon two-handed.

entries.name: Special
entries: You cannot gain the benefits of the feat Great Weapon Master while Double Weaponing this weapon.

entries.name: Special
entries: You wield this weapon without the use of a hand, instead using the foot the dagger is affixed to. You may only make one attack on your turn when attacking with this weapon.

entries.name: Special
entries: While this weapon is sheathed, your hands are considered free.

entries.name: Special
entries: While wielding two gauntlets and no shield, you increase your Armor Class by 1. You can only benefit from this effect once.

entries.name: Special
entries: While you're wielding this weapon, you can still make a Grapple check. On a success, you grapple your opponent with the sickle-edge of your sword, keeping them locked and dealing {@dice 1d4} piercing damage at the start of their turn.

entries.name: Special
entries: This weapon deals {@dice 1d8} damage to environmental objects and creatures with the Plant type.

entries.name: Special
entries: When used as a Double Weapon, the Kusarigama gains the reach property.

entries.name: Alternate Name
entries: This weapon goes by an alternate name: Kusarigama.

entries.name: Alternate Name
entries: This weapon goes by an alternate name: Sto√üdolch.

entries.name: Special
entries: When you make an attack against a medium or large creature, you also attack any enemies directly to its left or right. On a hit, those creatures take {@dice 1d4} slashing damage.

baseitem.name: Headphones
entries: Headphones are a pair of earphones joined by a band placed over the head, for listening to audio signals such as music or speech. They can be connected using an audio jack attached to a wire (or ocassionally, through a wireless pairing mechanism known as bluetooth) in order to receive audio files from an output device (usually a smartphone, music player, or equivalent).

The volume of the output device can generally be adjusted in order to change the decibels at which the audio is played. Maximizing or near-maximizing the volume will result in the user being put under the {@condition deafened} condition, as they are unable to hear anything other than the audio pouring out from the internal speakers.

Headphones can be reskinned as earphones. If done so, their weight reduced by a considerable margin (generally anywhere from 0.01 lbs to 0.05 lbs). In addition, headphones that utilize bluetooth connectively require time to charge, similar to that of smartphones.
{@bold Technological.} As a pure technological item, nothing as to how this item functions is a result of magic, and as such, it is unaffected by spells such as dispel magic and antimagic circle.

baseitem.name: Smartphone
entries: A mobile phone that performs many of the functions of a computer, typically having a touchscreen interface, Internet access, and an operating system capable of running downloaded applications.
There are many things a smartphone has access to, which includes but are not limited to:

{@bold Communication.} Conversations using smartphones can be made across long distances, similar to that of sending stones. However, the difference lies in the ability to have full-length conversations back-and-forth through the digital wire. In addition, two smartphones do not need to be linked, and any smartphone in the world can be called by simply dialing another smartphone's number.

{@bold Networking.} Various applications can be accessed utilizing a smartphone, such as news apps that grant numerous amounts of up-to-date information about the world. This information, without a smartphone, would normally be gathered via bulletin or through use of a television screen.

{@bold Gaming.} Games can be played on smartphones, granting the user something to do when passing a large amount of time, such as when the party decides to take a short rest. Boredom on long trips is a real issue, you know.

{@bold Limited Use.} The main issue with smartphones are their limited uses outside of nations with proper wire networking such as Slecrotor and Zyraitix‚Äîwithout any cellphone communication towers, communication and networking is left as an impossibility (although games can still be played on smartphones without a connection). Smartphones will refuse to dial outside of their designated service range, usually a few miles away from a cellphone tower or equivalent.

{@bold Charging.} Majority of all smartphones are charged using a wired USB device that plugs into a wall socket or power outlet. In most cases, it is also possible to charge smartphones using a wireless charging device powered via spellstone known as a {@italic mana dynamo}. Many inns which serve out-of-state guests, specifically around populated epicenters for carousing and trade, will have these devices.
{@bold Technological.} As a pure technological item, nothing as to how this item functions is a result of magic, and as such, it is unaffected by spells such as dispel magic and antimagic circle.

baseitem.name: Flashlight
entries: Flashlights come in a wide variety of sizes and quality levels. Those covered here are professional, heavy-duty models, rugged enough to withstand the rigors of modern adventuring.
{@bold Penlight.} This small flashlight can be carried on a key ring. It projects bright light in a 10 foot cone, and dim light for an additional 10 feet.
{@bold Standard.} This heavy metal flashlight projects bright light in a 30 foot cone, and dim light for an additional 30 feet.
{@bold Battery Flood.} Practically a handheld spotlight, this item projects bright light in a 100 foot cone, and dim light for an additional 100 feet.
{@italic In addition, flashlights have multiple properties which make them unique:}

{@bold Battery Powered.} The majority of flashlights must be powered using batteries. A full set of batteries in a flashlight will allow it to last for ten minutes, after which the batteries must be replaced. You can purchase new batteries in any store that offers them, usually in technologically-adept nations such as Slecrotor and Zyraitix. Notably, battery flood flashlights require advanced batteries.
{@bold Technological.} As a pure technological item, nothing as to how this item functions is a result of magic, and as such, it is unaffected by spells such as dispel magic and antimagic circle.

baseitem.name: Standard Batteries
entries: These batteries can be used to power most items that state they require them. Any device that uses batteries comes with them. Different items require varying amount of batteries, shown by the following list:
{@bold Flashlights.} Penlight and Standard flashlights can be powered by inserting three standard batteries into their core, which last for ten minutes.
{@italic In addition, batteries have properties which make them unique:}
{@bold Technological.} As a pure technological item, nothing as to how this item functions is a result of magic, and as such, it is unaffected by spells such as dispel magic and antimagic circle.

baseitem.name: Advanced Batteries
entries: These batteries can be used to power most items that state they require them. Any device that uses batteries comes with them. Different items require varying amount of batteries, shown by the following list:
{@bold Flashlights.} Battery Flood flashlights can be powered by inserting two advanced batteries into their core, which last for ten minutes.
{@italic In addition, batteries have properties which make them unique:}
{@bold Technological.} As a pure technological item, nothing as to how this item functions is a result of magic, and as such, it is unaffected by spells such as dispel magic and antimagic circle.

baseitem.name: Chemical Light Stick
entries: This disposable plastic stick, when activated, uses a chemical reaction to create light for 6 hours. It illuminates an area only 5 feet in radius. Once activated, it can‚Äôt be turned off or reused.ss
{@bold Technological.} As a pure technological item, nothing as to how this item functions is a result of magic, and as such, it is unaffected by spells such as dispel magic and antimagic circle.

baseitem.name: Gas Mask
entries: This apparatus covers the face and connects to a chemical air filter canister to protect the lungs and eyes from toxic gases. It provides total protection from eye and lung irritants. The filter canister lasts for 12 hours of use. Changing a filter is an action. The value for one extra filter canister is 6 gold.
{@bold Technological.} As a pure technological item, nothing as to how this item functions is a result of magic, and as such, it is unaffected by spells such as dispel magic and antimagic circle.

baseitem.name: Spike Strip
entries: This device is designed to help the police end car chases. The strip comes rolled in a spool about the size of a small suitcase. It can be deployed as an action by rolling it across a roadway, where it lies like a flat, segmented belt (at maximum it extends 15 by 5 feet). Until the strip is activated, the spikes do not protrude, and cars can pass safely over it. You can activate it as a reaction via a control device attached to the end of the strip by a 10-foot-long cord, causing the spikes to extend.

Any creature that enters the area must succeed on a DC 15 Dexterity saving throw or stop moving and take 1 piercing damage. Until the creature regains at least 1 hit point, its walking speed is reduced by 10 feet. A creature moving through the area at half speed doesn‚Äôt need to make the saving throw.

Wheeled vehicles passing over an activated strip are automatically hit regardless at the speed they were travelling at, although vehicles equipped with puncture-resistant tires are not affected. When a vehicle is hit by an activated strip, their movement speed is restricted to phase 1 for 3 rounds, and after those 3 rounds elapse, their movement speed becomes 0 until their tires are repaired.
{@bold Technological.} As a pure technological item, nothing as to how this item functions is a result of magic, and as such, it is unaffected by spells such as dispel magic and antimagic circle.

baseitem.name: Steel Handcuffs
entries: Handcuffs are restraints designed to lock two limbs‚Äînormally the wrists‚Äîof a prisoner together. They fit any Medium-size or Small human or other creature that has an appropriate body structure. You can make an opposed Strength ({@skill Athletics}) check against a grappled creature to attach the handcuffs to the creature, putting them under the {@condition restrained} condition.

These heavy-duty cuffs require a Strength ({@skill Athletics}) check with a DC of 25 to break, and require a Dexterity ({@skill Sleight of Hand}) check or Dexterity ({@skill Acrobatics}) check (DC 20) to remove without the key.
Steel Handcuffs, upon purchasing, always come with a key, which can be used to unlock the handcuffs without a check.
{@bold Technological.} As a pure technological item, nothing as to how this item functions is a result of magic, and as such, it is unaffected by spells such as dispel magic and antimagic circle.

baseitem.name: Zip-Tie
entries: Handcuffs are restraints designed to lock two limbs‚Äînormally the wrists‚Äîof a prisoner together. They fit any Medium-size or Small human or other creature that has an appropriate body structure. You can make an opposed Strength ({@skill Athletics}) check against a grappled creature to attach the handcuffs to the creature, putting them under the {@condition restrained} condition.

These are single-use disposable handcuffs, much like heavy-duty cable ties. They require a Strength ({@skill Athletics}) check with a DC of 20 to break, and require a Dexterity ({@skill Sleight of Hand}) check or Dexterity ({@skill Acrobatics}) check (DC 15) to remove. They can only be removed by cutting them off.
{@bold Technological.} As a pure technological item, nothing as to how this item functions is a result of magic, and as such, it is unaffected by spells such as dispel magic and antimagic circle.

baseitem.name: Recorder
entries: This small metal device fits in your hand like a charm, and is loosely equipped with a few functions, the primary of which allow its user to record the vocal utterances of another creature.

This device can record up to five minutes of audio without stopping, and while you cannot record more than five minutes, you can delete your previous recordings in order to free-up space. Whenever you finish recording a creature, ask your DM how much time elapsed to determine how much space you have left in your recorder.
{@bold Technological.} As a pure technological item, nothing as to how this item functions is a result of magic, and as such, it is unaffected by spells such as dispel magic and antimagic circle.

entries.name: Special
entries: A creature can remove a bola from an allied creature as an action. In addition, while a creature is grappled by a bola, they can fall prone. While prone, their speed is no longer limited by the {@condition grappled} condition.

entries.name: Special
entries: If this weapon is used to make a melee weapon attack, it instead becomes an Improvised Weapon.

entries.name: Special
entries: If this weapon is used to make a melee weapon attack, it instead becomes an Improvised Weapon.

entries.name: Special
entries: If your target is within 5 feet of you, it takes an additional {@dice 1d6} piercing damage on a hit.

entries.name: Special
entries: Enemies adjacent to you take an additional {@dice 1d4} piercing damage on a hit.

baseitem.name: The Beginner's Blade
entries: This decorated longsword appears to be a simple showpiece and not meant for battle. When sheathed at the hip of the wearer the hilt of the blade gives off a bright blue and gold shine.
While attuned to this sword the wearer is able to cast the following spells:
{@italic Item designed by @Aizea La Win#5106.}

baseitem.name: Aci Feather
entries: While this feather is equipped on your person, you can use a bonus action to make your hair dramatically blow in a nonexistent breeze.
{@italic Item designed by @Amarulence#5357.}

baseitem.name: Doom Box
entries: This simple wooden box, seemingly crafted with shoddy materials, creates {@dice 1d4} harmless spiders every week.
{@italic Item designed by @Amarulence#5357.}

baseitem.name: Zingaro, the 10-Copper Mug
entries: This mug has a slot on its side, just large enough to fit a coin. Slotting in 10 copper coins will produce a mild-flavored ale or beer (accompanied by an arcade-style ding for each coin slotted in).
The coins vanish upon being inserted. In addition, the nearest establishment that sells beverages of the alcoholic variety will receive the money in the till or lockbox of their business.
The side of the mug has a simple logo: {@bold Zingaro}. Meanwhile, the bottom has been engraved with small, runic letters: {@italic "Zingaro, the beer for your generation".}
{@italic Item designed by @Mr.Philanthropic#0001.}

baseitem.name: Quantum Ring
entries: This ring turns invisible when worn.
{@italic Item designed by @Amarulence#5357.}

baseitem.name: Quantum Eyeglass
entries: A white eyeglass that extend outwards 1-foot, decorated with strange gold markings. Looking through this glass allows you to see yourself as if you were looking at yourself from afar. It's often called the "Stalking Glass".
{@italic Item designed by @Amarulence#5357.}

baseitem.name: Quantum Belt
entries: This dazzling belt reflects anything against the buckle with serene clarity, and cannot be smudged by even the grimiest of fingerprints. The buckle is shaped like a large letter "Q", and looks unnecessarily gaudy.

Toward the side of the belt is a small leather pouch, which can hold one type of kit by storing it in the Astral Plane. While inside this pouch, the kit becomes weightless and non-detectable by magical means.
Placing any item inside the pouch that isn't a kit will cause it to fall out, as the leather is ripped open from the inside out. After this, the belt ceases to be magical.
{@italic Item designed by @KuroiHoshi#4159.}

The pole of this sickly scythe is marred with scorch marks in crass patterns. The curved blade is an immaculate onyx with a soft purple orb glowing in it's center. Small arcs of violet plasmic energy crackle around the weapon.
You gain a +2 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this weapon. It has the following additional properties:

{@italic {@bold Doom}}. When you roll a 20 with this weapon, the target gains one level of {@condition exhaustion}. This does not work on constructs, undead, or other creatures immune to exhaustion. This exhaustion lasts until the charges are expended, the target takes a long rest, or the target dies.
{@italic {@bold Gloom}}. This weapon gains one charge for each successful activation of Doom up to a total of 6 charges. These charges last until your next long rest.
It takes one bonus action to activate charges 1-3 and a full action to activate 4-6.

rows: You gain advantage on ability checks for the next minute.
You gain double your movement speed for the next minute.
You gain advantage on attack rolls and saving throws for the next minute and are concentrating on this effect.
You gain temporary hit points equal to half your maximum HP total.
You cast the haste spell targetting only your self and are concentrating on it for the next minute.

For the next minute, the next attack that hits instantly kills the target. This does not affect constructs, creatures without a soul,  creatures immune to exhaustion, or creatures with legendary actions. Such creatures takes an extra {@dice 6d8} necrotic damage from the hit.

entries: {@italic Item designed by @Aizea La Win#5106.}

entries.name: Special
entries: When you make an attack against a medium or large creature, you also attack any enemies directly to its left or right. On a hit, those creatures take {@dice 1d4} slashing damage.

baseitem.name: Obsidian Weapon
entries: You gain a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with these obsidian weapons of demonic make.

These weapons deal {@dice 2d6} damage instead of their normal damage dice, and landing a critical hit with the weapon doesn‚Äôt double the weapon‚Äôs damage dice. Whenever you land an attack with the weapon and roll the same number on both of the weapon‚Äôs damage dice, you can immediately roll another d6 and add it to the weapon's damage dice.
You can continue rolling extra damage dice until you roll a number that does not match the previous rolls.
{@italic Item designed by @Aizea La Win#5106.}
{@italic {@bold Base items}}. This item variant can be applied to the following base items:

baseitem.name: Returning Weapon
entries: When this weapon is thrown as part of an attack, it returns to its wielder immediately after the attack.
{@italic Item designed by @Aizea La Win#5106.}
{@italic {@bold Base items}}. This item variant can be applied to the following base items:

baseitem.name: Cap of the Cartographer
entries: {@italic Do you suck at reading maps? At telling which way is north, south, east, weast?! Fear no more! The Cap of the Cartographer is just what you need!}
While wearing this dark blue flat cap, you can see where you are on any map you are holding that contains your current location.
{@italic Item designed by @Gebri#6969.}

baseitem.name: Returning Weapon +1
entries: You have a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this magic weapon.
When this weapon is thrown as part of an attack, it returns to its wielder immediately after the attack.
{@italic Item designed by @Aizea La Win#5106.}
{@italic {@bold Base items}}. This item variant can be applied to the following base items:

baseitem.name: Returning Weapon +2
entries: You have a +2 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this magic weapon.
When this weapon is thrown as part of an attack, it returns to its wielder immediately after the attack.
{@italic Item designed by @Aizea La Win#5106.}
{@italic {@bold Base items}}. This item variant can be applied to the following base items:

baseitem.name: Koi's Retreat
entries: This iron shield has a small glass domed boss at its center, filled with mystic water that houses two koi fish which perpetually circle one another. The koi fish can bring forth good fortune, but only when left at rest.

When this item is placed on a flat natural surface (such as earth or stone) for at least 1 hour undisturbed, the glass dome expands to fill the entire width of shield, allowing the koi roam around this makeshift pond freely where they begin to glow.

The first creature who touches the dome while the koi are glowing receives a divine blessing. Once during the next 24 hours, when that creature rolls a 1 on a {@dice d20} roll they can treat that roll as a 20 instead.

After the blessing is bestowed, the dome shrinks back to the normal size of the boss and the shield can be equipped as normal. Once a blessing has been granted, it cannot do so again until {@dice 2d4} days have passed.
{@italic Item designed by @Aizea La Win#5106.}

baseitem.name: Arvhim Pear Phone
entries: {@italic Avel Caelora doesn't have phones? Not for much longer! We here at Arvhim Technology are spreading the wondrous technology the Pear Phone™ to the masses!}
As an action, the user may dismiss or summon the Pear Phone™ to their hand or away into a pocket space. Upon resummoning, the user may decide to change the color of the Pear Phone™.
{@italic Item designed by @Aizea La Win#5106.}

baseitem.name: Solar Surfer
entries: This custom-built machine (designed to be used by Solar Sailors in the Skywatcher Grand Prix) is designed to be small enough to be carried and even used for fast transport when travelling. Their quick-activation and portability make them a smart option for those in Accord who wish to get around quickly and faster than the required effort to retrieve a crew and pilot an airship.

The surfboard itself weighs 10 pounds and remains folded until the user speaks the command word, which can be customized for each solar surfer. While extended, the solar surfer requires direct sunlight to function. If achieved, it has a flying speed of 100 feet and can carry up to 400 pounds, but its flying speed becomes halved feet while carrying over 200 pounds.

A pilot can angle the sail to change direction, and the surfboard hovers in the air until they choose to land. A solar surfer requires a least one free hand to pilot, although a solar surfer can remain in the air with no hands on the controls (making it possible for a pilot to use a two-handed weapon while in the air).

In addition, a pilot can reflect the light of the sun through the sails at an enemy. That creature must make a DC 15 Constitution saving throw or take {@dice 3d8+1d4} radiant damage, or half as much on a successful save. A sail's delicate living-fibers can only channel the sun's radiance 5 times before needing to be repaired, which the living-fibers does at a rate of 1 charge each dawn.

A pilot can attempt to fire an additional charge from their solar surfer beyond the fifth, but doing so will fry the internal components of the sail, and the solar surfer will immediately plummet to the ground, having become unusable and unrepairable.
{@italic Item designed by @Amarulence#5357.}

baseitem.name: Pen-Accelerator Mk. V

entries: These five orbital nanolasers revolve in an arc around your back‚Äîthe set of oscillating crystals at their cores reflecting light back in a sheen of colors representative of their elemental properties. A small computer attaches to your waist underneath your clothes, hooked up to wires connected to sensing pads on your body which can translate the firing of synapses in your mind.

As a bonus action on your turn, you can fire one of the five lasers at an ally or hostile creature. Each laser has a range of 90 feet, and an attack roll equal to your proficiency bonus + your Intelligence modifier (if required).

rows: On a hit, deals {@dice 1d4+2} cold damage.
On a hit, deals {@dice 1d4+2} lightning damage.
On a hit, deals {@dice 1d4+2} fire damage.
Gives a creature {@dice 1d4+2} temporary hit points.
Heals a creature for {@dice 1d4} hit points.

entries: Your Pen-Accelerator has 10 charges, and firing any laser expends one charge. You regain all expended charges on a long rest.
{@italic Item designed by @Amarulence#5357.}
{@bold Technological.} As a pure technological item, nothing as to how this item functions is a result of magic, and as such, it is unaffected by spells such as dispel magic and antimagic circle.

baseitem.name: Tri-Accelerator Mk. III

entries: These three orbital nanolasers revolve in an arc around your back‚Äîthe set of oscillating crystals at their cores reflecting light back as shimmering daylight. A small computer attaches to your waist underneath your clothes, hooked up to wires connected to sensing pads on your body which can translate the firing of synapses in your mind.
As a bonus action on your turn, you can expend up to 3 charges to induce an effect based on how many charges you expend.

rows: Your movement speed increases by 20 for 3 turns.
Your movement speed increases by 40 for 2 turns.
Your movement speed increases by 80 for 1 turn.

entries: This bonus movement speed applies {@italic after} any other effects that would modify your movement speed, including the Dash action. The Tri-Accelerator has 3 charges, and regains all expended charges on a long rest.
{@italic Item designed by @Amarulence#5357.}
{@bold Technological.} As a pure technological item, nothing as to how this item functions is a result of magic, and as such, it is unaffected by spells such as dispel magic and antimagic circle.

baseitem.name: Lightning Lashed
entries: You can use a bonus action to speak this magic weapon's command word, causing lightning to arc over the blade or head. This lightning sheds dim light in a 10-foot radius.

While the lightning persists, it deals an extra {@dice 2d6} lightning damage to any target it hits. The lightning lasts until you use a bonus action to speak the command word again or until you drop or sheathe the weapon.
{@italic Item designed by @DIO#6259.}
{@italic {@bold Base items}}. This item variant can be applied to the following base items:

baseitem.name: Black Inches
entries: A long, pitch black, whip with metal tips which is said to have caused more than a few red cheeks.
You have a +2 to hit and damage rolls with this magic weapon.
This weapon deals an additional {@dice 1d4} piercing damage on a hit.

{@bold Red Cheeks}. When you hit on an attack roll, you cause the target to Bleed if it has blood. A Bleeding creature captures your attention, giving you advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks to track down Bleeding targets. A creature continues to Bleed until they take a short or long rest or a successful Wisdom (Medicine) check (DC 14) is made to stop the bleeding.
{@bold Bloody Hell}. For every Bleeding target within 30 feet of you, you gain a stacking buff up to a max of 5.
For each stack of {@italic Bloody Hell} that you have, you gain 5 walking speed when moving towards a Bleeding creature.

{@bold Bloodlust}. When you hit maximum stacks of {@italic Bloody Hell}, you enter a crazed bloodlust for the next ten minutes or until every Bleeding creature dies. During this Bloodlust, you lose 2 Wisdom, but whenever you deal damage with this whip to a Bleeding target, double the weapon's damage die.
{@italic Item designed by @DIO#6259.}

baseitem.name: Armor of the Beheaded
entries: This complete suit of plate armor is missing its helmet, and only a glance is needed to reveal a chilling aura. It was found on the body of a headless horseman slain by a high-ranking adventuring party, and beyond that, nothing else is known.

{@bold Curse of the Beheaded}. Upon attuning to this armor, the wearer must succeed on a DC 20 Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, the wearer is beheaded and becomes classified as a headless horseman. The attunement is transferred to your own head, as opposed to being connected to the armor. The residue of magic then dissipates, turning the suit into nothing more than an ordinary set of plate armor.
No blood gushes out from the wound as the wearer‚Äôs head hits the floor‚Äîneither does the wearer die, as might be expected from this situation. Instead, only the head becomes inanimate.
The wearer continues to see, smell, and hear as they normally would, although they lose their ability to speak and cannot cast spells that require a verbal component.

Your vision is under the effect of the spell {@spell arcane eye} centered at the area where your eyes used to be. Because this effect is magical in nature, a {@spell dispel magic} spell can temporarily disable your senses for one minute, and entering an {@spell antimagic field} will leave you under the blinded and deafened condition. You will also be unable to smell, but retain the ability to feel and touch.

Another small boon the armor grants you is a permanent +1 bonus to AC that lasts even after doffing the armor, represented by one of your body's most vital regions now having become untargetable. In addition, the curse also grants the wielder a new creature type: monstrosity.

Doffing the armor does not end the curse. Unattuning to the item or removing the curse through outside means causes the effects of the beheading to truly transpire, effectively killing the wearer (assuming a head is needed to survive for their specific race).

{@bold Blessing of the Dullhan}. If the wearer succeeds their Constitution saving throw, they still receive all the side effects of the {@italic Curse of the Beheaded}. You are considered to be a dullahan instead of a headless horseman. In addition, the wearer receives the following benefits:

items: Your head, while detached from your body, remains fully functional. You retain the ability to cast spells that require a verbal component.
As a bonus action, you can attach and detach your head at will.

As a free action, you can exchange and trade senses between your body and your head. Your body‚Äôs vision is still considered magical and can be temporarily shut down through {@spell dispel magic} or an {@spell antimagic field}, but your head‚Äôs senses are not magical. You can experience both senses simultaneously, allowing you to feel through your hands and talk through your head.

While your head is at your side or attached, you gain darkvision out to 60 feet (if you did not have it previously). In addition, when you move, you can move up to half of your walking speed as flying speed. This is represented by you walking on manifested shadowy terrain, as per the legends of the dullahan. You must end your movement on a solid object or the ground. If you do not, you fall and your movement ends.
You cannot be forcefully unattuned from this blessing while you are conscious.

entries: {@italic Item designed by @Amarulence#5357.}

baseitem.name: Basic Casting Assistant Device (CAD)
entries: The Casting Assistant Device, better known as CAD, is a spell support processor. This device incorporates synthetic materials (artificially manufactured Neurons) that convert Psion signals into electric signals, using the Psion from a magic ritual (sequence) to produce a collection of electronic magic‚Äîthe Activation Sequence of a spell.
CADs allows the processing of all the necessary components for magic in a single moment. In detail, these devices help accelerate the invocation of magic, as well as provide stability.

Choose whether your CAD takes the form of a bracelet, necklace, simple melee weapon, or {@item pistol|srp}. You can not use your CAD to perform a melee or ranged attack (unless you are using it as an improvised weapon).

While attuned to a basic CAD, you gain a +1 bonus to spell attack rolls and to the saving throw DCs of any spell that requires you have a Psionic Talent feature, Psionic Focus, or the Wild Talent feat.

You can modify your CAD with cartridges, which will temporary evolve the weapon for a limited amount of uses. You can only have one cartridge slotted into a CAD at a time. Swapping out cartridges is an object interaction. These cartridges can also be found in the Guild Shop.
{@italic Item designed by @Amarulence#5357.}
{@bold Technological}. As a pure technological item, nothing as to how this item functions is a result of magic, and as such, it is unaffected by spells such as dispel magic and antimagic circle.

baseitem.name: Bo Prime
entries: You have a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this magic weapon.

This quarterstaff is engraved in a blue-and-red runic alphabet. The words are ancient enough to be considered untranslatable, and in the hands of a spellcaster, they glow with a soft white energy. The polearm itself is made of solid steel, with gold trimmings along the outside ushering an aura of prosperity.

When you make a melee weapon attack with this weapon, you can choose to expend one charge in order to channel your mana into the staff. Your attack rolls are made using your Intelligence modifier, and you add your Intelligence modifier to damage instead of the weapon's normal modifier.

During the channeling process, Bo Prime vibrates with a intensity equal to the mana you channel inside it. If you successfully land a hit, you can force the target to make a Constitution saving throw using your spell save DC. On a failed save, the target becomes {@condition incapacitated} until the start of your next turn.

Your channeled mana dissipates after your first successful hit with the weapon. You have a number of charges equal to half you Intelligence modifier (rounded up, minimum of 1), and regain all expended charges on a long rest.
{@italic Item designed by @Amarulence#5357.}

baseitem.name: Quick Picks
entries: These colorful picks attach to your fingers and allow for vibrant strumming. You can click your picks together in order to manifest a small sound that travels no further than 30 feet, so long as that sound is percussive in nature. Each pick is inscribed with a singular glyph from a runic alphabet. Translation is currently impossible‚Äîalthough really, nobody wants to know what they say anyway.

{@bold Instantaneous Instrument}. While attuned to these picks, you can use a bonus action to manifest a stringed musical instrument in your empty hand. You choose the form that this instrument takes each time you create it.

Your {@italic Instantaneous Instrument} disappears if it is more than 5 feet away from you for more than a minute. It also disappears if you use this feature again, you dismiss the instrument as a free action, or you die.

You can choose to transform a stringed instrument of your choice into your {@italic Instantaneous Instrument} by performing a special ritual. The ritual is known as the "Seance of Sick Guitar Riffs", and takes place over the course of one hour. After the ritual is complete, you dismiss the instrument, shunting it into an extradimensional space.

Whenever you use your {@italic Instantaneous Instrument} from that point on, you summon the instrument you saved as part of your ritual. It retains the same appearance and statistics as it did when you completed the ritual. You cannot affect an artifact or a sentient instrument in this way. The instrument ceases to be your {@italic Instantaneous Instrument} if you die, perform the ritual on a different instrument, or play a sick guitar riff and say "My instrument no longer" in a deep voice.

Regardless of how you break your bond, when it occurs, the instrument previously saved into your extradimensional space crash lands onto a nearby balcony alongside the departure of a murder of ravens.
{@italic While attuned to these picks, you also gain the following benefits:}
{@bold Swing String}. You gain a bonus to your Initiative equal to your Charisma modifier.

{@bold Your Music Sucks Too Asshole}! When a creature that you can see within 60 feet of you makes an attack roll, ability check, or a saving throw, you can use your reaction to impose disadvantage on the roll. You can use this feature a number of times equal to your Charisma modifier (minimum of once), and regain all expended charges on a long rest. You can choose to use this feature after the creature rolls the d20, but before the DM tells you the result of the roll.
{@italic Item designed by @Amarulence#5357.}

baseitem.name: Cold Spaulder
entries: This metal shoulder guard is always chilly to the touch.  While worn, willfully ignoring another humanoid's attempt to converse with you causes them to experience a sensation of chills running down their spine.
{@italic Item designed by @Aizea La Win#5106.}

baseitem.name: Cartridge: Centaur Series (CAD)
entries: This cartridge, while slotted into a Basic CAD, changes its name to the "General-Purpose Centaur CAD", and gives it the following effect:

items: Whenever your Psionic die would decrease by one die size, you can expend one charge to retain its current value.

entries: You have 5 charges, and once all charges are depleted, the cartridge becomes nonmagical.
{@italic Item designed by @Amarulence#5357.}

baseitem.name: Cartridge: Sorcery Booster (CAD)
entries: This cartridge, while slotted into a Basic CAD, changes its name to the "No Head Dragon CAD", and gives it the following effect:

items: Whenever an enemy would be forced to make a saving throw against a spell that requires you have a Psionic Talent feature, Psionic Focus, or the Wild Talent feat, you can expend a charge to impose disadvantage on the throw.

entries: You have 3 charges, and once all charges are depleted, the cartridge becomes nonmagical.
{@italic Item designed by @Amarulence#5357.}

baseitem.name: Cartridge: Taurus Silver (CAD)
entries: This cartridge, while slotted into a Basic CAD, changes its name to the "Taurus Silver CAD", and gives it the following effect:

items: When you would cast a spell that requires you have a Psionic Talent feature, Psionic Focus, or the Wild Talent feat that requires an action, you can expend a charge to make it a bonus action.

entries: You have 3 charges, and once all charges are depleted, the cartridge becomes nonmagical.
{@italic Item designed by @Amarulence#5357.}

baseitem.name: Hadar's Abominable Elixir
entries: Upon consuming this crystal-infused black elixir, your arms begin to bulge and pulsate, transforming into long, slimy tentacles.
You attack with your tentacles in place of your normal unarmed strikes, which deal {@dice 2d6} acid damage on a hit. In addition, your unarmed strikes gain a reach of 10 feet.

While under the effects of this elixir, you lose the ability to perform dexterous tasks, such as wielding weapons, carrying shields for defense, or performing careful procedures such as surgery. You are not considered unarmed or wielding monk weapons for the purposes of the monk's Martial Arts feature.
This effects of this elixir last for one hour. At the conclusion of the hour, roll a {@dice d20}. On a roll of 1, the effects become permanent.
{@italic Item designed by @Amarulence#5357.}

baseitem.name: Cartridge: Experiment Realizer (CAD)
entries: This cartridge, while slotted into a Basic CAD, changes its name to the "Experiment Realizer CAD", and gives it the following effect:

items: You can expend one a charge to cast the {@spell dancing lights} cantrip as a bonus action.

entries: You have 5 charges, and once all charges are depleted, the cartridge becomes nonmagical.
{@italic Item designed by @Amarulence#5357.}

baseitem.name: Basic Universal Tuning Device (UTD)
entries: The Universal Tuning Device, better known as UTD, is a spell support processor. This device incorporates synthetic materials (artificially manufactured Neurons) that convert Psion signals into electric signals, using the Psion from a magic ritual (sequence) to produce a collection of electronic magic‚Äîthe Activation Sequence of a spell.

UTDs allows for the modification of magic in a single moment. In detail, these devices allow for on-the-fly measures, as well as provide unique opportunities to take advantages of a target's weaknesses.

Choose whether your UTD takes the form of a bracelet, necklace, simple melee weapon, or {@item pistol|srp}. You can not use your UTD to perform a melee or ranged attack (unless you are using it as an improvised weapon).

While attuned to a basic UTD, you can cast the mending spell at will. When cast this way, you can repair a break or tear up to 5 feet in size. In addition, you can reroll 1s on spells. That roll must restore hit points or be a damage roll that deals cold, fire, or lightning damage.

You can modify your UTD with cartridges, which will temporary evolve the weapon for a limited amount of uses. You can only have one cartridge slotted into a UTD at a time. Swapping out cartridges is an object interaction. These cartridges can also be found in the Guild Shop.
{@italic Item designed by @Amarulence#5357.}
{@bold Technological}. As a pure technological item, nothing as to how this item functions is a result of magic, and as such, it is unaffected by spells such as dispel magic and antimagic circle.

baseitem.name: Cartridge: Quick Tuning (UTD)
entries: This cartridge, while slotted into a Basic UTD, changes its name to the "Quick Tuning UTD", and gives it the following effect:

items: When you cast a spell that deals cold, fire, or lightning damage, you can expend a charge. Change that damage type to one of the following: cold, fire, or lightning.

entries: You have 6 charges, and once all charges are depleted, the cartridge becomes nonmagical.
{@italic Item designed by @Amarulence#5357.}

baseitem.name: Cartridge: Evolution Tuning (UTD)
entries: This cartridge, while slotted into a Basic UTD, changes its name to the "Evolution Tuning UTD", and gives it the following effect:

items: When you cast cast a spell that deals cold, fire, or lightning damage, you can expend a charge. You can roll one additional damage die for that spell. You choose whether the additional damage die deals cold, fire, or lightning damage. Regardless of what you choose, the additional damage die cannot deal the same damage type as the base spell.

entries: You have 3 charges, and once all charges are depleted, the cartridge becomes nonmagical.
{@italic Item designed by @Amarulence#5357.}

baseitem.name: Cartridge: Rewrite (UTD)
entries: This cartridge, while slotted into a Basic UTD, changes its name to the "Accel Ultima UTD", and gives it the following effect:

items: When you cast a spell of 2nd-level or higher that restores hit points or deals cold, fire, or lightning damage, you can expend a charge. You replicate the effects of the spell as if it were upcast by one spell slot, but you only exhaust the appropriate on-level spell slot.

entries: You have 3 charges, and once all charges are depleted, the cartridge becomes nonmagical.
{@italic Item designed by @Amarulence#5357.}

baseitem.name: Cartridge: Medica Silver (UTD)
entries: This cartridge, while slotted into a Basic UTD, changes its name to the "Medica Silver UTD", and gives it the following effect:

items: When you cast a spell that restores hit points, you can expend a charge. Add your Intelligence modifier to the roll.

entries: You have 5 charges, and once all charges are depleted, the cartridge becomes nonmagical.
{@italic Item designed by @Amarulence#5357.}

baseitem.name: Cartridge: Grand Accel (UTD)
entries: This cartridge, while slotted into a Basic UTD, changes its name to the "Grand Accel UTD", and gives it the following effect:

items: While this cartridge is slotted in, you can reroll 1s on rolls that give temporary hit points, or damage rolls that deal radiant, necrotic, or thunder damage.

entries: {@italic Item designed by @Amarulence#5357.}

baseitem.name: Wanderering Blade
entries: You have a +2 to attack and damage rolls made with this magic weapon.

This weapon has found it's way to many different hands over the years. The runes on this blade light ablaze with sickening radiance. Blades of this type are talked about throughout history, inspiring awe and fear depending on who lays their eyes on the blade.

When you hit a creature with this greatsword, you can choose to channel the blade's history into the target. That creature must make a Wisdom saving throw (DC 16) or be {@condition frightened} by the wielder until the end of their next turn, as the deaths of every creature felled by the blade flashes before their eyes. On a successful save, the creature becomes immune to this effect for 2 rounds.
{@italic Item designed by @bigbeefydood11#1340.}

baseitem.name: Plastic Explosive
entries: Plastic explosives are a soft and hand-moldable solid form of explosive material. Plastic explosives are especially suited for explosive demolition of obstacles and fortifications by engineers, combat engineers and criminals. It can be cut, formed, wrapped, and combined with others of its type.

{@bold Planted.} Each creature within 5 feet of the explosive must make a Dexterity saving throw, taking {@dice 3d6} bludgeoning damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. It deals double damage against objects and structures.

You can combine units of plastic explosive so they explode at the same time. Each additional pound of plastic explosive increases the damage by {@dice 1d6} (to a maximum of {@dice 10d6}) and the burst radius by 5 feet (to a maximum of 20 feet).
In addition, when you combine two or more units, you can change the burst radius to a cone-shaped explosion (you must determine the area affected by the explosive when you plant it).
{@bold Technological.} As a pure technological item, nothing as to how this item functions is a result of magic, and as such, it is unaffected by spells such as dispel magic and antimagic circle.
{@italic Item designed by @Gebri#6969.}

baseitem.name: Tear Gas
entries: Tear gas works by irritating mucous membranes in the eyes, nose, mouth and lungs, and causes crying, sneezing, coughing, difficulty breathing, pain in the eyes, and temporary blindness.

{@bold Grenade.} As an action, a character can throw a smoke grenade at a point. One round after the grenade lands, it emits a cloud of tear gas that creates a heavily obscured area in a 20-foot radius. It disperses after 1 minute, though a moderate wind (at least 10 miles per hour) disperses the smoke in 4 rounds; a strong wind (20 or more miles per hour) disperses it in 1 round. Any creature starting its turn in the gas is considered {@condition blinded} and it must make a Constitution saving throw or be {@condition incapacitated} (DC 15). A creature wearing a gas mask automatically succeeds the saving throw.
{@bold Technological.} As a pure technological item, nothing as to how this item functions is a result of magic, and as such, it is unaffected by spells such as dispel magic and antimagic circle.
{@italic Item designed by @Gebri#6969.}

baseitem.name: Fire Extinguisher
entries: The extinguisher has 10 charges. As an action, you can expend one charge to extinguish a 5-foot area of fire.
{@bold Technological.} As a pure technological item, nothing as to how this item functions is a result of magic, and as such, it is unaffected by spells such as dispel magic and antimagic circle.
{@italic Item designed by @Gebri#6969.}

baseitem.name: Infrared Goggles
entries: An infrared goggles has 10 charges. As a bonus action, you can expend one charge to turn them on to see in dim light within 60 feet of you as if it were bright light, and in darkness as if it were dim light for 10 minutes. You can't discern color in darkness and the image color produced is typically monochrome (shades of green or blue).
This item can be recharged if an adequate power source (such as batteries) are used to do so.
{@bold Technological.} As a pure technological item, nothing as to how this item functions is a result of magic, and as such, it is unaffected by spells such as dispel magic and antimagic circle.
{@italic Item designed by @Gebri#6969.}

baseitem.name: Metal Detector
entries: A handled portable sensor for detecting bits and pieces of metal in and on the ground. The metal detector has 10 charges. As an action, you can expend one charge to gain advantage on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks you make when searching for metals and metallic objects for 10 minutes.
{@bold Technological.} As a pure technological item, nothing as to how this item functions is a result of magic, and as such, it is unaffected by spells such as dispel magic and antimagic circle.
{@italic Item designed by @Gebri#6969.}

baseitem.name: Two-Way Radio
entries: A hand-held, portable, two-way radio transceiver. Multiple radios use a single channel, and only one radio on the channel can transmit at a time, although any number can listen. The transceiver is normally in receiving mode and when the user wants to talk he presses a "push-to-talk" button. You can communicate with someone using a two-way radio at the same frequency up to 20 miles.
{@bold Technological.} As a pure technological item, nothing as to how this item functions is a result of magic, and as such, it is unaffected by spells such as dispel magic and antimagic circle.
{@italic Item designed by @Gebri#6969.}

baseitem.name: Blinkback Belt
entries: A set of clips are attached to this segmented belt constructed of metallic links. Up to two melee weapons or up to four light melee weapons can be hung from the belt in straps or sheaths. These weapons must not have the two-handed or double-bladed property.

When the wearer draws a weapon attached to this belt and throws it before the end of their next turn, the weapon teleports back to its strap or sheath immediately after the attack is resolved. If the weapon drops to the ground or if the wearer is disarmed of their weapon, they immediately teleport back to their belt at the start of their turn.
Removing or switching weapons requires the user to end their attunement or to attune to belt once more.
{@italic Item designed by @MiriamRose#2345.}

baseitem.name: Conversing Mirrors
entries: This item comes in a box-set of two near-indestructible mirrors that can withstand a direct collision with a semi. They are connected through a planar wire that spans the entire Multiverse.

As an action, you can "ring" the other mirror, appearing as a request for communication on the adjacent mirror. Accepting the call will broadcast whatever the mirror is reflecting to the other mirror's screen, as well as voice. Either party can disconnect the mirror's connection at will, as well as turn off the reflection-sharing properties or temporarily mute the audio.

These mirrors can be used to speak long distances, commune with commanding officers, or even just keep in touch with loved ones on an arduous journey. And unlike cellphones, they can be used interplanar and in areas without cellphone towers.

However, due to their expensive production, quantity is rare, and the price is astronomical. Because of this, these mirrors aren't used often by the Association, militaristic organizations, or the aforementioned couple-in-love, as only nobles and wealthy Adventurers are able to afford them.
{@italic Item designed by @Amarulence#5357.}

baseitem.name: Manastone Bracelets
entries: {@italic "Allow me to take off my training bracelets."}
{@italic "This isn't even my final form!"}
{@italic "I have trapped my power in these bracelets for thousands of years. Now, you will see my true power!"}
Two linked bracelets created through a divine union of manastone and witchwood. These bracelets attach to each adjacent wrist, and limit the user's power through an infraction of space-time.

While wearing these bracelets, you can purposely weaken yourself to any level below your current. In order to reduce a creature's power, the creature wearing these bracelets must willingly accept their influence, making them useless as magical handcuffs.

Once you willingly accept the bracelets influence and select a level to be reduced to, the bracelets lock shut around your wrists, and you must speak their command word in order to release them. Releasing the bracelets restores you to your full power. You cannot incrementally increase or decrease your power any further once you accept the bracelet's influence.

You cannot use these bracelets to attend lower-tiered quests, nor can you force a creature through magic or mind control to accept their influence. These bracelets cannot be deactivated through any effects such as an antimagic field once they are bound to a creature.
{@italic Item designed by @Amarulence#5357.}

baseitem.name: Cloak of Recognition Obstruction
entries: A white cloak with a blue, soft silk interior. Two protrusions rise from the head with an upwards point, leading to cloak receiving a nickname among assassins and spies: "the Cat-Earred Cloak".

While you wear this cloak with its hood up, your identity is obstructed from being perceived by any creature who lacks divinity. The cloak does not make you invisible, and your presence and identity can still be detected through other forms of magic and technology. However, creatures attempting to recognize you will find the act impossible, and their minds will be warped with a similar effect to that of prosopagnosia.
{@italic Item designed by @Amarulence#5357.}

baseitem.name: Frefil's Jolly Oozebean Sugarbombs

entries: You can eat one of these delicious, jelly-filled sweets as a bonus action on your turn. Each one comes with a side effect that lasts for one hour and depends on the associated color and flavor of the bean. Refer below when determining the bean's effects. Each bag contains one bean of each type.

{@bold Upset Stomach}. You can only be under the effects of one sugarbomb that has this property at a time. Eating a sugarbomb while already under the effects of another one ends the first one's effect early and forces you to make a DC 13 Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, you become {@condition poisoned} for 1 minute.

rows: Gummy exterior with a watery center. You can breathe underwater.
Thick, but effervescent. You have resistance to acid damage and can safely eat otherwise inedible & nonpoisonous organic materials.
Pleasantly gummy, but slightly numbs the mouth. Grappling or being grappled deals {@dice 1d8} acid damage to the other creature.
Harder exterior with a gooey center. You have advantage on saving throws against being {@condition charmed} or {@condition frightened}.
Rubbery and chewy. You gain a climbing speed equal to your movement speed.
Thick and coats the tongue slightly. You gain {@dice 1d8+4} temporary hit points.

Spongey center covered with a dissolving shell. You have resistance to poison damage and advantage on ability checks to escape the {@condition grappled} condition and {@condition restrained} condition.
Slippery and resilient. You have resistance against lightning damage and immunity to damage from the magic missile spell.

entries: {@italic Item designed by @Gebri#6969.}

baseitem.name: Infernal Puzzle Box
entries: An infernal puzzle box is a cube-shaped container 5 to 6 inches on a side, composed of airtight, interlocking parts made from materials found in the Nine Hells. Most of these boxes are made of infernal iron, though some are carved from bone or horn. Infernal puzzle boxes are used to safeguard diabolical contracts signed between devils and mortals, even after the terms of these contracts are fulfilled. An empty infernal puzzle box weighs 3 pounds regardless of the materials used to fashion it.

When an object small enough to fit inside an infernal puzzle box is placed in it, the container magically seals shut around the object, and no magic can force the box open. The sealed box becomes immune to all damage as well. Every infernal puzzle box is constructed with a unique means of opening it. The trick to solving the puzzle is always mundane, never magical. Once a creature figures out the trick or sequence of steps needed to open a particular infernal puzzle box, that creature can open the box as an action, allowing access to the box's contents.

A creature that spends 1 hour holding an infernal puzzle box while trying to open it can make a DC 30 Intelligence ({@skill Investigation}) check. If the check succeeds, the creature figures out the trick or sequence of steps needed to open the box. If the check fails by 5 or more, the creature must make a DC 18 Wisdom saving throw, taking 42 ({@dice 12d6}) psychic damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

baseitem.name: Storm Boomerang
entries: This boomerang is a ranged weapon carved from {@creature griffon} bone and etched with the symbol of elemental air. On a hit, the boomerang deals an additional {@dice 3d4} thunder damage, and the target must succeed on a DC 10 Constitution saving throw or be {@condition stunned} until the end of its next turn.

Once the boomerang deals thunder damage to a target, the weapon loses its ability to deal thunder damage and its ability to stun a target. These properties return after the boomerang spends at least 1 hour inside an elemental air node.

baseitem.name: Dagger of Blindsight
entries: This rare magic item requires attunement. A creature attuned to it gains {@sense blindsight} out to a range of 30 feet. The dagger has a saw-toothed edge and a black pearl nested in its pommel.

baseitem.name: Seawater Cutlass
entries: These curved blades trail golden light when swung through the air. You have a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this magic weapon.
On a successful hit with the cutlass, the target's speed is reduced by 10 feet until the start of your next turn.

baseitem.name: Spies' Murmur
entries: This headpiece, crafted from dark metal, is worn curved around the ear. If you know a creature wearing another Spies' Murmur and that creature is within 1 mile of you, you can communicate telepathically with each other. As a bonus action, you can allow that creature to hear everything you hear for 1 hour. You can end this effect as a bonus action, and it ends if you're {@condition incapacitated}.

baseitem.name: Gloves of Flaming Fury
entries: While you wear both of these leather gloves, any non-magical weapon you grasp with either glove is treated as a magic weapon.

As a bonus action, you can use the gloves to cause magical flames to envelop one or two melee weapons in your grasp. Each flaming weapon deals an extra {@dice 1d6} fire damage on a hit. The flames last until you sheath or let go of either weapon. Once used, this property can't be used again until the next dawn.

baseitem.name: Adaptive Helm
entries: This metal helmet is set with crystals that change color when exposed to elemental energy.

While wearing this helm, if you are the target of an attack which would deal acid, cold, fire, lightning, or thunder damage you can use a reaction to adapt to that damage type. While adapted, you have resistance to that damage type. The helm returns to its normal state after ten minutes.

baseitem.name: Lifewell Tattoo
entries: This tattoo comprises symbols of life and rebirth. While this tattoo is on your skin, you have resistance to necrotic damage.

entries.name: Death Ward
entries: When you would be reduced to 0 hit points, you drop to 1 hit point instead. Once used, this benefit can't be used again until the next dawn.

entries.name: Tattoo Attunement
entries: To attune to this item, you hold the needle to your skin where you want the tattoo to appear, pressing the needle there throughout the attunement process. When the attunement is complete, the needle turns into the ink that becomes the tattoo, which appears on the skin.
If your attunement to the tattoo ends, the tattoo vanishes, and the needle reappears in the closest unoccupied space to you.

baseitem.name: Coiling Grasp Tattoo
entries: Produced by a special needle, this magic tattoo has long intertwining designs. It dances around your arm in the shape of a snake.

entries.name: Grasping Tendrils
entries: While the tattoo is on your skin, you can, as an action, cause the tattoo to extrude into inky tendrils, which reach for a creature you can see within 15 feet of you. The creature must succeed on a DC 14 Strength saving throw or take {@dice 3d6} force damage and be {@condition grappled} by you. As an action, the creature can escape the grapple by succeeding on a DC 14 Strength ({@skill Athletics}) or Dexterity ({@skill Acrobatics}) check. The grapple also ends if you halt it (no action required), if the creature is ever more than 15 feet away from you, or if you use this tattoo on a different creature.

entries.name: Tattoo Attunement
entries: To attune to this item, you hold the needle to your skin where you want the tattoo to appear, pressing the needle there throughout the attunement process. When the attunement is complete, the needle turns into the ink that becomes the tattoo, which appears on the skin.
If your attunement to the tattoo ends, the tattoo vanishes, and the needle reappears in the closest unoccupied space to you.

baseitem.name: Masquerade's Tattoo
entries: Produced by a special needle, this magic tattoo appears on your body as whatever you desire.

entries.name: Fluid Ink
entries: As a bonus action, you can shape any tattoos you've attuned to into any color or pattern, and move it to any area of your skin. You can also cause the tattoo to become invisible, blending into your skin and becoming unrecognizable as one. When it comes to changing its shape, the tattoo can range in size from no smaller than a copper piece, to an intricate work of art that covers all your skin.

entries.name: Tattoo Attunement
entries: To attune to this item, you hold the needle to your skin where you want the tattoo to appear, pressing the needle there throughout the attunement process. When the attunement is complete, the needle turns into the ink that becomes the tattoo, which appears on the skin.
If your attunement to the tattoo ends, the tattoo vanishes, and the needle reappears in the closest unoccupied space to you.

entries.name: Specialized Attunement
entries: This tattoo shares its attunement with other tattoos, and does not count as an attunement so long as you are currently attuned to another tattoo that is not the Masquerade's Tattoo.
{@italic Item designed by @Amarulence#5357.}

baseitem.name: Lightbringer
entries: You have a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this magic weapon.

The head of this mace is shaped like a sunburst and made of solid brass. Named Lightbringer, this weapon glows as bright as a torch when its wielder commands. While glowing, the mace deals an extra {@dice 1d6} radiant damage to undead creatures.

baseitem.name: Bonecounter
entries: This weapon is a magical +2 mace called Bonecounter. Whenever this weapon is used to destroy an undead creature, a single silver piece appears in the wielder's pocket.

baseitem.name: Flying Chariot
entries: The chariot's riders and creatures pulling the chariot gain a +1 bonus to their AC.
If this magic chariot is pulled by one or more flying creatures, it too can fly.

entries.name: Chariots
entries: Chariots and the creatures pulling them work like controlled mounts, as described in the mounted combat rules in the {@book Player's Handbook|PHB|9|Mounted Combat}, but with the following differences:

items: Mounting or dismounting a chariot costs you 5 feet of movement, rather than a number of feet equal to half your speed.
Being mounted on a chariot grants you half cover.
A chariot's speed is equal to the speed of the slowest creature pulling it.
If multiple creatures are pulling the chariot, they all act on the same initiative, and they must take the same action on their turn.

baseitem.name: Weapon of Resurgence
entries: This weapon emanates a soft green aura while in the hands of a paladin and grants a +1 to attack and damage rolls.
If you hit a creature while attuned to this weapon, you regain one point of your lay on hands. You can only gain this benefit once per turn.
{@italic Item designed by @Aizea La Win#5106.}
{@italic {@bold Base items}}. This item variant can be applied to the following base items:

baseitem.name: Dress of Many Pockets
entries: This dress has many pockets. When someone compliments this dress, you can use your reaction to reply with "Thanks! It has pockets!" When you do, you can stick your hand into any pocket of the dress and pull out any mundane, non-magical, and non-consumable item of your choice. You can only pull out an item once per day per person that compliments the dress. Items pulled out from the dress disappear after 10 minutes.
{@italic "Nice dress, lil' missy," the old grizzled dwarf captain said, nodding to the halfling girl in a vibrant yellow sundress.}
{@italic "Thanks! It has pockets!" replied the little halfling girl, perhaps a bit too enthusiastically, as she pulls out a greataxe from her dress to demonstrate.}
{@italic Item designed by @Aizea La Win#5106.}

baseitem.name: Circlet of Mispronounciation
entries: While wearing this circlet, despite their best attempts, creatures in your vicinity will incessantly mispronounce your name. The mispronunciations will generally rhyme with your name, with each's phonetic spelling only being slightly different
{@italic Item designed by @Amarulence#5357.}

baseitem.name: Whistle of Duck Calling
entries: When you blow this whistle, a duck appears behind you. Once you blown on it, you must wait 5 minutes before using it again. Once used, any previous ducks summoned by this whistle disappears, and is replaced by the new duck.
{@italic Item designed by @Mr.Philanthropic#0001.}

baseitem.name: Stone of Healing
entries: This dull, gray stone is roughly the size of one's fist, and fits rather snuggly in the palm of one's hand. When a creature is struck with this stone, that creature takes {@dice 1d4} bludgeoning damage, immediately followed by healing for {@dice 1d4} health.
{@italic Item designed by @Amarulence#5357.}

baseitem.name: Wand of Magic Chickens
entries: This wand has 7 charges. While holding it, you can use an action to expend 1 or more of its charges to cast the magic missile spell from it. For 1 charge, you cast the 1st-level version of the spell. You can increase the spell slot level by one for each additional charge you expend.

Whenever this wand is used, the caster most roll a Wisdom saving throw (DC 10). On a failed save, the caster must shout "BACAWK!" at the top of their lungs and squawk like a chicken. This effect lasts for only a few seconds, and the caster is aware of their actions the entire time.
The wand regains {@dice 1d6+1} expended charges daily at dawn. If you expend the wand's last charge, roll a {@dice d20}. On a 1, the wand crumbles into ashes and is destroyed.
{@italic Item designed by @Amarulence#5357.}

baseitem.name: Rocket-Propelled Broom
entries: This wooden broom, which weighs quite an amount (10 pounds), functions like a mundane (if unwieldly) broom until you stand astride it and pull the chord that acts as its kick-starter. It then launches into the air, with a lever at the side allowing you to rectify it into a hovering position.

It has a flying speed of 80 feet and can carry up to 400 pounds, but its flying speed becomes halved feet while carrying over 200 pounds. In addition, when attempting to move while overloaded, the rider must roll a d20. On a roll of 1, the broom falters as the rocket jams, causing you to fall at a speed of 30 feet per round until the broom is kick-started back up (requiring an action).

The broom cannot travel more than 60-feet above any surface, as the antigravity sensors on its lower ridge would malfunction, causing the broom to stall and fall at a speed of 30 feet per round before restarting itself after reapproaching its maximum height.

You can send the broom to travel alone to a destination within 1 mile of you so long as you can enter the coordinates in the planar transport module (a task which requires a successful Intelligence check with a DC 15. Seriously, who designed this thing?!). A failed save will result in your broom taking you somewhere {@italic a bit} off the mark, with the definition of "a bit" being up to DM discretion.

While flying on this broom, the amount of noise it kicks up as the rocket propels you forward and the engine hums provides ample opportunity for your presence to be discovered. Any item or spell that can remove sound (such as the silence spell) will block out this sound as it would any normal mundane item.
{@italic Item designed by @Amarulence#5357.}
{@bold Technological}. As a pure technological item, nothing as to how this item functions is a result of magic, and as such, it is unaffected by spells such as dispel magic and antimagic circle.

baseitem.name: Strom Headphones
entries: These, as the young kids call it, hip headphones are some of the most mainstream and popular brand around. They are a sleek black and come in over the ear and bud form. The younger generation of Zyratix considers these a must have when listening to music.

While wearing both halves of the headphones you are under the {@condition deafened} condition and listen to some cool jams. While deafened by these headphones you are immune to charm effects that require you to hear. You are still able to wear one and not be deafened.
{@italic Item designed by @Aizea La Win#5106.}
{@bold Technological}. As a pure technological item, nothing as to how this item functions is a result of magic, and as such, it is unaffected by spells such as dispel magic and antimagic circle.

baseitem.name: Nairek Boombox Mk. II
entries: This large contraption has a variety of knobs, dials, and sliders, with a certain instrument designed onto the back. It is often compared to it's smaller alternative, the remixer.

While holding this device, a creature can use its action to have Nayrek Remixer start listening. If anything within 30 feet of the device is performing with sound, whether using an instrument, singing, or something else, the ring can store the sounds of it provided it listens for at least five minutes. The Nayrek Remixer can hold up to 100 different "songs" on it.
As an item interaction the user may have a song playback. This music can be heard up to 100 feet away but can also be channeled through a pair of headphones and privately listened.

The user may also spend an additional item interaction to crank up the volume to max. While at max volume the distance the device can be heard extends 100 feet and any creature that can hear within 30 feet of the boombox makes concentration checks at disadvantage.
If in Zyratix, the user may upload songs from a central database rather than record them live.
{@italic Item designed by @Aizea La Win#5106.}
{@bold Technological}. As a pure technological item, nothing as to how this item functions is a result of magic, and as such, it is unaffected by spells such as dispel magic and antimagic circle.

baseitem.name: Nairek Remixer
entries: This simple metal box is about the size of a match lighter with a small display on its face, with a certain instrument designed onto the back. Often an item used by younger audiences to listen to music,

While holding this device, a creature can use its action to have Nayrek Remixer start listening. If anything within 30 feet of the device is performing with sound, whether using an instrument, singing, or something else, the ring can store the sounds of it provided it listens for at least five minutes. The Nayrek Remixer can hold up to 60 different "songs" on it.
As an item interaction the user may have a song playback. This music can be heard up to 60 feet away but can also be channeled through a pair of headphones and privately listened.
If in Zyratix, the user may upload songs from a central database rather than record them live.
{@italic Item designed by @Aizea La Win#5106.}
{@bold Technological}. As a pure technological item, nothing as to how this item functions is a result of magic, and as such, it is unaffected by spells such as dispel magic and antimagic circle.

baseitem.name: Akalizer Baton
entries: This fluorescent baton has an accented glow of a variety of colors ranging from blue, orange, purple, green, and white. It is one foot long but extends to roughly 3 feet.
While holding this baton the user may spend an action extending and constructing a motorcycle from the device. This has the normal statistics of a motorcycle with these adjustments:

items: It has a damage threshold of 10.

entries: {@italic Item designed by @Aizea La Win#5106.}
{@bold Technological}. As a pure technological item, nothing as to how this item functions is a result of magic, and as such, it is unaffected by spells such as dispel magic and antimagic circle.

baseitem.name: Flame-Enchanted Rifle
entries: You gain a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this magic weapon.

This weapon has been modified with magic runes. As a free action, the wielder may activate the runes on this weapon. While activated, the next attack does an additional {@dice 2d6} fire damage, and if the attack hits a creature, it must make a DC 15 Strength save or be knocked prone. Once used this way, the rune becomes innert for 24 hours.
{@italic Item designed by @EPICENDER#0745.}

baseitem.name: Cloak of Cherry Blossoms
entries: While wearing this cloak, you can use a bonus action to cause a small storm of harmless cherry blossoms to flutter around you.
{@italic Item designed by @DIO#6259.}

baseitem.name: Cosmic Car Keys
entries: A set of car keys on a silver ring, with a little black box with a small red button on it.

These car keys can be paired with any technological vehicle after a ten minute linking process. Afterwards, the vehicle in question is shunted into its own personal pocket dimension. The car keys can only be linked to one vehicle at a time and, as such, this pocket dimension can hold one vehicle as well.

As a bonus action, you can press the button on the car keys, opening a portal to the pocket dimension and dispensing the linked vehicle within five feet of the user. Pressing the button again will shunt the vehicle back into the pocket dimension, immediately expelling any creatures inside or on the vehicle.
{@italic Item designed by @DIO#6259.}

baseitem.name: Ghost Captain's Coat
entries: This coat is nice and crisp. Black leather runs down the entire frame of your body, like a trenchcoat, and your fancy pauldrons are made fancy with the thin tuffs of fur protruding from their edges. It truly makes you look the part of a captain.
While attuned to this coat, you gain proficiency with vehicles (water) if you do not already have it.
This coat has 3 charges. Once per day, you can cast the {@spell suggestion} spell (save DC 15) from it by expending 1 charge. You regain all expended charges each dawn.

In addition, the ghostly-fabric of the coat's make allows you to temporarily transcend boundaries. You can move through other creatures and objects other than physical barriers (such as walls, floors, or ceilings) as if they were difficult terrain. On your turn, you can pass through up to 10 feet of physical barriers (treating them as difficult terrain) as a part of your movement. If you end your turn inside an object or barrier, you take {@dice 1d10} force damage and are immediately ejected to the closest available space.
Once you move through a creature or object this way, you cannot do so again until next dawn.
{@italic Item designed by @Amarulence#5357.}

baseitem.name: Rod of Big Spheres
entries: This rod has 3 charges. While holding the rod, you can use an action to expend one of the rod's charges and create a sphere of force that hovers 3 feet off the ground.

This sphere can hold up to 200 pounds, and follow you around at a distance you determine for up to 2 hours. The sphere is destroyed if it takes any damage, but any objects inside float to the ground as if affected by the ùòßùò¶ùò¢ùòµùò©ùò¶ùò≥ ùòßùò¢ùò≠ùò≠ spell.
You can create up to 3 spheres per day, and the rod regains 3 charges daily at dawn.
{@italic Item designed by @Amarulence#5357.}

baseitem.name: Seeds of Wealth

entries: These seeds resemble the seeds of a beech tree, but when successfully raised from sapling to blossom, they bear coins instead of fruit. Raising the tree from a mere sapling to its branching wisdom requires one month of tending.
When the tree blossoms, roll on the table to determine what type of coin the tree will bear:
The tree will bear a singular harvest, and afterwards, no more coins will blossom forth. The branches contain {@dice 20d20} coins of the type you rolled.
{@italic Item designed by @Amarulence#5357.}

baseitem.name: Balance of Power
entries: This scale glows with a ethereal light, beckoning those who have crossed its waters to obtain it with a glorious melody.
When a gem worth at least 500 GP is placed within the left-hand tray, the scale tips, and the gem shatters before completely being absorbed into the right-hand tray.

Afterwards, tangible energy rises from the right-hand tray and flies straight into your soul, as you become blessed with divine power. For the next 24 hours, an ability score of your choice is raised to 18. After the 24 hours elapse, that elevated ability score returns to normal.
You can only use this scale once per week, as it requires time to recharge its divine energies.
{@italic Item designed by @Amarulence#5357.}

baseitem.name: Golden Tongue
entries: This charm, in the shape of a small golden tongue, hangs from a necklace or strap and glimmers with a brilliant yellow sheen. Occasionally, you think you can hear whispers as if the tongue were attempting to communicate with you, but surely that's just your imagination.
While attuned, you can give yourself advantage on a Charisma ({@skill Persuasion}) check. However, if you choose to do so, you are required to make your argument in rhyming couplets.
If you fail to speak in rhyme when making this check, the check is instead rolled at normal, and you take {@dice 1d8} psychic damage.
{@italic Item designed by @Amarulence#5357.}

baseitem.name: Staff of the Geomancer
baseitem.reqAttune: by a bard, cleric, druid, sorcerer, or wizard
entries: This staff has 10 charges. While holding it, you can use an action to expend 1 or more of its charges to cast one of the following spells from it, using your spell save DC and spellcasting ability modifier: {@spell stone shape} (1 charge), {@spell meld into stone} (2 charges), {@spell move earth} (4 charges), or {@spell wall of stone} (4 charges).
The staff regains {@dice 1d6 + 4} expended charges daily at dawn. If you expend the last charge, roll a {@dice d20}. On a 1, the staff blackens, crumbles into cinders, and is destroyed.
{@italic Item designed by @Amarulence#5357.}

baseitem.name: Chimes of the Will-o'-Wisp
entries: This item can only be used by a bard.
These golden wind chimes flow in a non-existent breeze. They are not pushed by natural wind, but rather dance to the breeze of their own tune. They shine like a beacon in the Ethereal Plane.

Whenever a creature regains extra hit points from your Song of Rest feature, that creature gains resistance to one of the following damage types for up to one hour (their choice): acid, cold, fire, necrotic, thunder, or bludgeoning, piercing or slashing from non-magical weapons.
Once a creature has reduced damage from the chosen damage type, this effect ends.
{@italic Item designed by @Amarulence#5357.}

baseitem.name: Emblem of 1,000 Arms
