entries: This emblem attaches to a piece of clothing or armor via a pin on the backside. The emblem itself shows a golden fist in flight, multiplying to infinity as its afterimages clash alongside it. The backing is made of high-quality silver and steel.
While you are attuned to this emblem, whenever you use your Flurry of Blows feature, you can spend 2 ki points to make two additional unarmed strikes. You can only gain this effect once per turn.
{@italic Item designed by @Amarulence#5357.}

baseitem.name: Brute's Tattoo
entries: This tattoo incorporates a light of a dagger in flight. Its swipe is detailed using arcs of ink, which effortlessly slot into larger designs like it was meant to be there.

entries.name: Rougish Vitality
entries: After you use a bonus action granted by your Cunning Action feature, you gain a number of temporary hit points equal to 1 + your Constitution modifier. These temporary hit points last for one minute. In addition, if you use your bonus action to {@action Dash} using your Cunning Action feature and step within reach of a hostile creature, you can make a single attack as a free action. You can only use the second effect of Rougish Vitality once per turn.

entries.name: Tattoo Attunement
entries: To attune to this item, you hold the needle to your skin where you want the tattoo to appear, pressing the needle there throughout the attunement process. When the attunement is complete, the needle turns into the ink that becomes the tattoo, which appears on the skin.
If your attunement to the tattoo ends, the tattoo vanishes, and the needle reappears in the closest unoccupied space to you.
{@italic Item designed by @Amarulence#5357.}

baseitem.name: Gloves of the Viper
entries: These gloves slide over your hands like a thin veil of silk, although they feel coarse and rough. Black in color with spots of green, they make an interesting fashion statement. Thankfully though, fashion isn't the primary reason for donning these gloves.

After you regain hit points using your Second Wind feature, the next ranged or melee weapon attack you successfully hit with this turn deals an additional {@dice 1d10} + half your Fighter level poison damage.

In addition, a creature hit by the attack must make a Constitution saving throw with a DC equal to 8 + your proficiency bonus + your Strength or Dexterity modifier. On a failed save, that creature is poisoned until the end of their next turn.
{@italic Item designed by @Amarulence#5357.}

baseitem.name: Wand of Sudden Transposition
entries: This wand has 7 charges. While holding it, you can use an action to expend 1 charge and suddenly transpose two creatures of your choice.

Choose two Small or Medium creatures that you can see within 120 feet. The creatures you select must either standing on the same surface or standing on surfaces which are physically connected by solid ground or structures.

A creature which is unwilling to be transposed must make a Charisma saving throw equal to your spell save DC. If neither creature makes a successful saving throw, both creatures are teleported, with each reappearing in the space previously occupied by the other.
This wand requires a verbal component to activate.
{@italic Item designed by @Amarulence#5357.}

baseitem.name: Makeshift Figurine
entries: This figurine of wondrous power is a statuette of no discernible shape, crafted to look like a neckpiece, symbol, or other such fashionable item. Magical teleportation runes etched into the surface betray the figurine's wondrous properties, and a small hook is located near the top in order to allow it to become a necklace.

After channeling for one minute, you can speak the makeshift figurine's command word and hold it out towards a willing creature you control within 10 feet of you which does not have the humanoid type. That creature's presence is inscribed into the figurine, storing both their spirit and their body into the magic of the item.
If you use an action to speak the command word in reverse and hold out the figurine once more, the creature you stored within the makeshift figurine is summoned at a point within 60 feet of you.

Unlike a normal figurine, this makeshift figurine does not magically tie a creature to it. If a creature that once inhabited the figurine drops to 0 hit points, the creature does not jump back into the figurine. The purpose of the makeshift figurine is to allow safe transport of creatures under the user's control, and does not seek to extend those creature's life.
While in the figurine, the creature is considered to be unconscious. The creature does not need to eat, drink, or breathe while stored inside the figurine.
{@italic Item designed by @Amarulence#5357.}

baseitem.name: Magnetic Weapon Holder Strips
entries: These small yet powerful magnets are placed on the legs, waist, or back, and are used to hold any equipment with a magnetic property (i.e., metallic objects). Typically, these strips mainly used to holster weapons when not in use, and can be integrated in armor. However, it has been adapted to also be worn without armor using straps. These magnetic strips allows the user to carry weapons with ease up to a maximum of four (up to two weapons with the heavy property). However, this system does not alleviate weight.
While wearing this system, the user can switch between one holstered weapon to another as a single item interaction.
{@bold Technological.} As a pure technological item, nothing as to how this item functions is a result of magic, and as such, it is unaffected by spells such as dispel magic and antimagic circle.
{@italic Item designed by @MiriamRose#2345.}

baseitem.name: Medi-Gel
entries: A useful item in both Zyrian civilian life and in the military. Medi-Gel is a medical agent produced by the Zaibatsu Corp. It is exported to neighboring countries. It is advanced enough to treat various kinds of wounds from blunt trauma to burns. Medi-Gel can be purchased legally over-the-counter.
As an action, a creature can apply a gel to the skin. The creature that receives it regains {@dice 2d4} hit points.
{@bold Technological.} As a pure technological item, nothing as to how this item functions is a result of magic, and as such, it is unaffected by spells such as dispel magic and antimagic circle.
{@italic Item designed by @MiriamRose#2345.}

baseitem.name: Bio-Foam
entries: A useful item in both Zyrian civilian life and in the military. It is exported to neighboring countries. A form of a first aid, Bio-Foam protects and seals wounds and regenerates tissue. Bio-Foam can be purchased legally over-the-counter.

Bio-Foam comes in a single canister, enough for one use. As an action, a creature can stablize a target and render them immune to disease for {@dice 1d4} hours. Additionally, a stablized creature will regain consciousness in one hour instead of {@dice 1d4} hours.
{@bold Technological.} As a pure technological item, nothing as to how this item functions is a result of magic, and as such, it is unaffected by spells such as dispel magic and antimagic circle.
{@italic Item designed by @MiriamRose#2345.}

baseitem.name: Handkerchief of Length
entries: This item appears to be a normal silk handkerchief. However, when you place it in your pocket and speak the command word, you can then pull from your pocket a 50-foot long line of multi-colored handkerchiefs tied to each other. This functions exactly like a regular piece of rope.
When you stuff the handkerchiefs back in your pocket, they revert to the original handkerchief.
{@italic Item designed by @Amarulence#5357.}

baseitem.name: Through the Fire and the Flames
entries: These pair of gauntlets are shaped in the likeness of a dragon's mouth. You can cast the spell {@spell burning hands} once from each fist, for a total of two times, with a DC of 13. Once you use each fist this way, you cannot do so again until next dawn.
In addition, you gain a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls using unarmed strikes with this weapon.
{@italic Item designed by @Aizea La Win#5106.}

baseitem.name: Kindermore's Tincture of Disfigurement
entries: This vial of thick liquid of swirling greens and pinks holds one use of Kindermore's Tincture of Disfigurement. If applied to an area of the body, the tincture causes severe and painful acid burns that last for {@dice 1d4} hours. After 1 minute of severe pain, the wound begins to heal and the pain subsides. A disfigured skin scarification is in place of the skin that the tincture was applied to. The scars fully heal after {@di8ce 1d4} hours and the creature's appearance is returned to normal.

The tincture causes the target to take {@dice 3d8} acid damage. It's hit point maximum is also reduced by an amount equal to the damage taken. The effect cannot cause the target's maximum hit points to drop to 0. If it would drop to 0, the target instead is reduced to a maximum of 1, falls unconscious, and must begin making death saving throws.  At the end of the duration, the effects on a target's maximum hit points is removed and the target regains the lost HP.
The healing effect at the end of the duration does not occur if the creature dies. The healing effect of the tincture has no effect on constructs, undead, or inanimate objects.

The acid can be applied to the face in an attempt to disguise a creatures identity. A successful DC 20 Intelligence check  is necessary to discern the true identity. The effect does not end for the entire duration except through the {@spell regenerate} or {@spell wish} spells.
{@italic Item designed by @Aizea La Win#5106.}

baseitem.name: Elemental Fang, Fire
entries: You gain a +1 to attack and damage rolls with this item.
You can cast the {@spell scorching ray} spell from the lance (+5 attack bonus). This spell cannot be cast again from the lance again until next dawn.

Additionally, you can empower one of your strikes with elemental energy, increasing its strength by {@dice 1d10} fire damage. You must move 20 feet in a straight line and declare this effect before the attack is made. Using this effect expends a charge, of which you have 3. You regain all expended charges each dawn.
{@italic Item designed by @Aizea La Win#5106.}

baseitem.name: Elemental Fang, Cold
entries: You gain a +1 to attack and damage rolls with this item.
You can cast the {@spell snilloc's snowball swarm} spell from the lance (DC 13). This spell cannot be cast again from the lance again until next dawn.

Additionally, you can empower one of your strikes with elemental energy, increasing its strength by {@dice 1d10} cold damage. You must move 20 feet in a straight line and declare this effect before the attack is made. Using this effect expends a charge, of which you have 3. You regain all expended charges each dawn.
{@italic Item designed by @Aizea La Win#5106.}

baseitem.name: Elemental Fang, Acid
entries: You gain a +1 to attack and damage rolls with this item.
You can cast the {@spell melf's acid arrow} spell from the lance (+5 attack bonus). This spell cannot be cast again from the lance again until next dawn.

Additionally, you can empower one of your strikes with elemental energy, increasing its strength by {@dice 1d10} acid damage. You must move 20 feet in a straight line and declare this effect before the attack is made. Using this effect expends a charge, of which you have 3. You regain all expended charges each dawn.
{@italic Item designed by @Aizea La Win#5106.}

baseitem.name: Elemental Fang, Lightning
entries: You gain a +1 to attack and damage rolls with this item.
You can cast the {@spell shatter} spell from the lance (DC 13). This spell cannot be cast again from the lance again until next dawn.

Additionally, you can empower one of your strikes with elemental energy, increasing its strength by {@dice 1d10} lightning damage. You must move 20 feet in a straight line and declare this effect before the attack is made. Using this effect expends a charge, of which you have 3. You regain all expended charges each dawn.
{@italic Item designed by @Aizea La Win#5106.}

baseitem.name: Stormcaller
entries: You gain a +2 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this magic weapon.
You can speak the command word of this bow as a bonus action. After doing so, for the next minute, the bow and all ammunition fired from it are charged with magical lightning.
While Stormcaller is charged, you can point a finger to the sky and shout, "Strike!" as a bonus action to cause lightning bolts to strike down at any piece of charged ammunition.

All creatures sharing the same space as a piece of charged ammunition in the ground must make a Dexterity saving throw (DC: 8 + your proficiency bonus + your Charisma modifier) or take {@dice 1d10} lightning damage (or half as much on a successful save). Any creature with a piece of charged ammunition lodged in its body or armor automatically fail this saving throw.
Once a piece of charged ammunition is struck by lightning, it loses its charge. You can‚Äôt use this property again until you finish a long rest.
{@italic Item designed by @Aizea La Win#5106.}

baseitem.name: Sigil of the Claw
entries: While wearing this sigil, you gain a +1 bonus to the attack rolls and the damage rolls you make with unarmed strikes and natural weapons. Such attacks are considered to be magical.

baseitem.name: Knave's Eye Patch
entries: While wearing this eye patch, you gain these benefits:

items: You have advantage on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks that rely on sight.
If you have the Sunlight Sensitivity trait, you are unaffected by the trait.
You are immune to magic that allows other creatures to read your thoughts or determine whether you are lying. Creatures can communicate telepathically with you only if you allow it.

baseitem.name: Bracer of Flying Daggers
entries: This armband appears to have thin {@item dagger|phb|daggers} strapped to it. As an action, you can pull up to two magic daggers from the bracer and immediately hurl them, making a ranged attack with each dagger. A dagger vanishes if you don't hurl it right away, and the daggers disappear right after they hit or miss. The bracer never runs out of daggers.

As a bonus action, the thrower can call back two of the illusory daggers, forcing all creatures in a line from where the daggers were launched to make a Dexterity saving throw (DC 8 + your proficiency bonus + your Dexterity modifier). On a failed save, those creatures take {@dice 2d4} piercing damage.

Additionally, the user can slot one dagger into the bracer as an item interaction. Doing this causes all future thrown daggers take on the attributes of the slotted dagger. You can only slot one dagger in these bracers at a time.
{@italic Item edited by @Aizea La Win#5106 and @Amarulence#5357.}

baseitem.name: Night Caller
entries: This whistle is carved from transparent crystal, and it resembles a tiny dragon curled up like a snail. The name Night Caller is etched on the whistle in Dwarvish runes. If a character succeeds on a DC 20 Intelligence ({@skill Arcana} or {@skill History}) check, the character recalls lore that says the {@creature duergar} made several such whistles for various groups in an age past.

If you blow the whistle in darkness or under the night sky, it allows you to cast the {@spell animate dead} spell. The target can be affected through up to 10 feet of soft earth or similar material, and if it is, it takes 1 minute to claw its way to the surface to serve you. Once the whistle has animated an undead creature, it can't do so again until 7 days have passed.
Once every 24 hours, you can blow the whistle to reassert control over one or two creatures you animated with it.

baseitem.name: Amulet of the Drunkard
entries: This amulet smells of old, ale-stained wood. While wearing it, you can regain {@dice 4d4 + 4} hit points when you drink a pint of beer, ale, mead, or wine. Once the amulet has restored hit points, it can't do so again until the next dawn.

baseitem.name: Blood Spear
entries: When you hit with a melee attack using this magic spear and reduce the target to 0 hit points, you gain {@dice 2d6} temporary hit points.

baseitem.name: Balloon Pack
entries: This backpack contains the spirit of an {@creature air elemental} and a compact leather balloon. While you're wearing the backpack, you can deploy the balloon as an action and gain the effect of the {@spell levitate} spell for 10 minutes, targeting yourself and requiring no concentration. Alternatively, you can use a reaction to deploy the balloon when you're falling and gain the effect of the {@spell feather fall} spell for yourself.

When either spell ends, the balloon slowly deflates as the elemental spirit escapes and returns to the Elemental Plane of Air. As the balloon deflates, you descend gently toward the ground for up to 60 feet. If you are still in the air at the end of this distance, you fall if you have no other means of staying aloft.
After the spirit departs, the backpack's property is unusable unless the backpack is recharged for 1 hour in an elemental air node, which binds another spirit to the backpack.

baseitem.name: Bottled Breath
entries: This bottle contains a breath of elemental air. When you inhale it, you either exhale it or hold it.

If you exhale the breath, you gain the effect of the {@spell gust of wind} spell. If you hold the breath, you don't need to breathe for 1 hour, though you can end this benefit early (for example, to speak). Ending it early doesn't give you the benefit of exhaling the breath.

baseitem.name: Paper Bird
entries: After you write a message of fifty words or fewer on this magic sheet of parchment and speak a creature's name, the parchment magically folds into a Tiny paper bird and flies to the recipient whose name you uttered. The recipient must be on the same plane of existence as you, otherwise the bird turns into ash as it takes flight.

The bird is an object that has 1 hit point, an Armor Class of 13, a flying speed of 60 feet, a Dexterity of 16 (+3), and a score of 1 (−5) in all other abilities, and it is immune to poison and psychic damage.

It travels to within 5 feet of its intended recipient by the most direct route, whereupon it turns into a nonmagical and inanimate sheet of parchment that can be unfolded only by the intended recipient. If the bird's hit points or speed is reduced to 0 or if it is otherwise immobilized, it turns into ash.
Paper birds usually come in small, flat boxes containing {@dice 1d6 + 3} sheets of the parchment.

baseitem.name: Needle of Mending
entries: This weapon is a magic dagger disguised as a sewing needle. When you hold it and use a bonus action to speak its command word, it transforms into a dagger or back into a needle.
You gain a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with the dagger. While holding it, you can use an action to cast the {@spell mending} cantrip from it.

baseitem.name: Robe of Serpents
entries: A robe of serpents is a stylish silk garment that is popular among wealthy nobles and retired assassins. The robe is emblazoned with {@dice 1d4 + 3} stylized serpents, all brightly colored.

As a bonus action on your turn, you can transform one of the robe's serpents into a {@creature giant poisonous snake}. The snake instantly falls from the robe, slithers into an unoccupied space next to you, and acts on your initiative count. The snake can tell friendly creatures from hostile ones and attacks the latter. The snake disappears in a harmless puff of smoke after 1 hour, when it drops to 0 hit points, or when you dismiss it (no action required). Once detached, a snake can't return to the robe. When all of the robe's snakes have detached, the robe becomes a nonmagical garment.

baseitem.name: Robe of Summer
entries: This elegant garment is made from fine cloth in hues of red, orange, and gold. While you wear the robe, you have resistance to cold damage. In addition, you are comfortable as if the temperature were that of a balmy day, so you suffer no ill effects from the weather's temperature extremes.

baseitem.name: Seeker Dart
entries: This small dart is decorated with designs like windy spirals that span the length of its shaft.

When you whisper the word "seek" and hurl this dart, it seeks out a target of your choice within 120 feet of you. You must have seen the target before, but you don't need to see it now. If the target isn't within range or if there is no clear path to it, the dart falls to the ground, its magic spent and wasted. Otherwise, elemental winds guide the dart instantly through the air to the target. The dart can pass though openings as narrow as 1 inch wide and can change direction to fly around corners.

When the dart reaches its target, the target must succeed on a DC 16 Dexterity saving throw or take {@dice 1d4} piercing damage and {@dice 3d4} lightning damage. The dart's magic is then spent, and it becomes an ordinary dart.

baseitem.name: Two-Birds Sling
entries: You have a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this weapon.

When you make a ranged attack with this sling and hit a target, you can cause the ammunition to ricochet toward a second target within 10 feet of the first, and then make a ranged attack against the second target.
{@italic Item suggested by @Ôº¢ Ôº° Ôº§ Ôº£ Ôº© Ôº∂ Ôº© Ôº¨ Ôº© Ôº∫ Ôº° Ôº¥ Ôº© ÔºØ ÔºÆ#5740.}

baseitem.name: Spell Rifle
entries: The spell rifle was developed as a way for ranged atillery mages to affect the battlefield from afar, and has gained popularity with wandslingers across Kagrea.
The spell rifle serves as a spellcasting focus and can be used by any spellcaster who can use a rod as a focus.

When held in two hands, you can use the rifle to cast cantrips at up to twice the standard range. However, when you cast a cantrip beyond the standard range, your attack rolls have disadvantage, and other creatures have advantage on any saving throws made against your cantrip.
As an example: a {@spell fire bolt} cast using a spell rifle has a range of 240 feet, but attack rolls against targets more than 120 feet away are made at disadvantage.
{@italic Item suggested by @„ÄéFucking Badass„Äè#9789.}
{@italic Item modified by @Amarulence#5357.}

baseitem.name: Dodecahedron of Doom
entries: This twelve-sided metal die is 12 inches across and bears the numbers 1 through 12 engraved on its pentagonal sides. The dodecahedron contains arcane clockwork mechanisms that whir and click whenever the die is cast.

The dodecahedron can be hurled up to 60 feet as an action. A random magical effect occurs when the die comes to rest after rolling across the ground for at least 10 feet. If an effect requires a target and no eligible target is within range, nothing happens. Spells cast by the dodecahedron require no components. Roll a {@dice d12} and consult the following table to determine the effect:

rows: The dodecahedron explodes and is destroyed. Each creature within 20 feet of the exploding die must make a DC 13 Dexterity saving throw, taking 40 ({@dice 9d8}) force damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.
The dodecahedron casts {@spell light} on itself. The effect lasts until a creature touches the die.
The dodecahedron casts {@spell ray of frost} (+5 to hit), targeting a random creature within 60 feet of it that doesn't have total cover against the attack.
The dodecahedron casts {@spell shocking grasp} (+5 to hit) on the next creature that touches it.
The dodecahedron casts {@spell darkness} on itself. The effect has a duration of 10 minutes.
The next creature to touch the dodecahedron gains {@dice 1d10} temporary hit points that last for 1 hour.

entries: {@italic Item suggested by @Canidae#0420.}

baseitem.name: Staff of the Ivory Claw
entries: This gray-and-cerulean staff is topped with a small dragon claw carved from ivory. While holding the staff, you gain a +1 bonus to spell attack rolls. Whenever you score a critical hit with a spell attack, the target takes an extra {@dice 3d6} radiant damage.
{@italic Item suggested by @sajigajis#3165.}

baseitem.name: Staff of Defense
entries: This slender, hollow staff is made of glass yet is as strong as oak. It weighs 3 pounds. You must be attuned to the staff to gain its benefits and cast its spells.

While holding the staff, you have a +1 bonus to your Armor Class. The staff has 10 charges, which are used to fuel the spells within it. With the staff in hand, you can use your action to cast one of the following spells from the staff if the spell is on your class's spell list: {@spell mage armor} (1 charge) or {@spell shield} (2 charges). No components are required.
The staff regains {@dice 1d6 + 4} expended charges each day at dawn. If you expend the staff's last charge, roll a {@dice d20}. On a 1, the staff shatters and is destroyed.
{@italic Item suggested by @Ôº¢ Ôº° Ôº§ Ôº£ Ôº© Ôº∂ Ôº© Ôº¨ Ôº© Ôº∫ Ôº° Ôº¥ Ôº© ÔºØ ÔºÆ#5740.}

baseitem.name: Ring of Temporal Salvation
entries: If you die while wearing this gray crystal ring, you vanish and reappear in an unoccupied space within 5 feet of the space you left (or the nearest unoccupied space). You have a number of hit points equal to {@dice 3d6} + your Constitution modifier. If your hit point maximum is lower than the number of hit points you regain, your hit point maximum rises to a similar amount. If you have any levels of {@condition exhaustion}, reduce your level of {@condition exhaustion} by 1. Once the ring is used, it turns to dust and is destroyed.
{@italic Item suggested by @„ÄéFucking Badass„Äè#9789.}

baseitem.name: Ventilating Lungs
entries: These metallic nodules were created in response to the poisonous gases used on the battlefields of the Last War. When you attune to these lungs, they replace the lungs in your chest, which disappear. The lungs allow you to breathe normally, even in an antimagic field, and their breathing function can't be suppressed by magic.

Outside an antimagic field or any other effect that suppresses magic, these lungs allow you to breathe normally in any environment (including a vacuum), and you have advantage on saving throws against harmful gases such as those created by a {@spell cloudkill} spell, a {@spell stinking cloud} spell, inhaled poisons, and gaseous breath weapons.

As an action, you can use these lungs to exhale a gust of wind, as if you had cast the {@spell gust of wind} spell (spell save DC 15) with no components. This property of the lungs can't be used again until the next dawn.
If your attunement to the lungs ends, your original lungs reappear.
{@italic Item suggested by @Ôº¢ Ôº° Ôº§ Ôº£ Ôº© Ôº∂ Ôº© Ôº¨ Ôº© Ôº∫ Ôº° Ôº¥ Ôº© ÔºØ ÔºÆ#5740.}

baseitem.name: Dead Man's Plate
entries: This jagged armor is made of castaway hooks and barbs. While wearing this armor, if you take the Attack action on your turn, you can use a bonus action to try to shove a creature within 5 feet of you. The shoved creature takes {@dice 1d8} piercing damage, in addition to either being knocked {@condition prone} or pushed.
The wearer has disadvantage on Dexterity ({@skill Stealth}) checks. If the wearer has a Strength score lower than 15, their speed is reduced by 10 feet.
{@italic Item suggested by @Ôº¢ Ôº° Ôº§ Ôº£ Ôº© Ôº∂ Ôº© Ôº¨ Ôº© Ôº∫ Ôº° Ôº¥ Ôº© ÔºØ ÔºÆ#5740.}

baseitem.name: Bag of Bounty
entries: This is a sturdy leather sack with tiny Siberys shards embedded into the lining. You can use an action to cast create food and water, drawing a feast from within the bag. You shape this meal with your thoughts. You can create the standard bland fare without requiring any sort of check, but you can attempt to create finer food by making a Charisma check; if you're proficient with cook's utensils, add your bonus to this check. A failed check results in a sour and squalid meal.
A bag of bounty can be used up to three times over the course of a day. After that, the bag can't be used again until the next dawn.
{@italic Item suggested by @Ôº¢ Ôº° Ôº§ Ôº£ Ôº© Ôº∂ Ôº© Ôº¨ Ôº© Ôº∫ Ôº° Ôº¥ Ôº© ÔºØ ÔºÆ#5740.}

baseitem.name: Ring of Truth Telling
entries: While wearing this ring, you have advantage on Wisdom ({@skill Insight}) checks to determine whether someone is lying to you.

baseitem.name: Ring of Obscuring
entries: This band of iron resembles a skull and is cold to the touch. It has 3 charges and regains {@dice 1d3} expended charges daily at dawn. As an action while wearing the ring, you can expend 1 of its charges to cast the {@spell fog cloud} spell from it, with the following changes: the cloud is centered on you when it first appears, and the spell lasts for 1 minute (no concentration required).

baseitem.name: Zelo's Morning After Pills
entries: A pill container filled with small white pills. Each container has 30 pills, of which a single pill can be used to accelerate the effects of being drunk. One pill while drunk will leave you with a hangover. One pill while hung over will leave you lucid. Two pills while drunk will leave you lucid.
{@italic Item designed by @Mr.Philanthropic#0001.}

baseitem.name: Aura of the Dragon
entries: {@italic This is the weapon of Bruniik, modified to be used by Tactus Agmulf.}

The Aura of the Dragon has seeped inside your soul, granting your mind focus and turning your fists to steel. This weapon represents a mastery of Bruniik's teachings‚Äîbut the growth of a student never ends. While you may have succeeded in Bruniik's rigorous combat training, the true training involves the soul, and the heart.

Attacking is a matter of projecting your aura outwards. Instilling the fortitude wrought by your mental training into the minds of your opponents. Such mastery of the draconic arts does not come lightly, however. You have begun to grow scales along your upper neck and arms. Rough and filled with heart, just like the training you were put through.
You gain a +2 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this magic weapon.
{@bold Knowledge of the Dragon}. While attuned to this weapon, your maximum {@italic knowledge points} increase by 2.

{@bold Mind of Focus}. While this weapon equipped, you are immune to magic that allows other creatures to read your thoughts, determine whether you are lying, know your alignment, or know your creature type.
{@bold Structure Mastery}. Whenever you hit an object with this weapon, the hit is a critical hit.
{@bold Fist of Steel}. When you successfully hit with this weapon, you can choose to expend a number of knowledge points up to your maximum in order to enact one of the following effects:

rows: Instead of its normal damage, your weapon now deals {@dice 2d6} radiant and {@dice 1d6} bludgeoning damage until the end of your turn.

The creature you hit must make a Constitution saving throw (DC 8 + your proficiency bonus + your Strength modifier). On a failed save, their initiative drops by {@dice 1d6}. If they would drop one or more turns in initiative, they are {@condition stunned} until the end of your next turn.
Starting from the point at which you activate this ability, you regain half of the damage you deal as hit points until the end of your turn.

You implant a part of your soul into the creature you hit, ravaging their body from the inside-out. That creature must make a Strength, Constitution, and Charisma saving throw (DC + your proficiency bonus + your Constitution modifier). On one or more failed saves, that creature unattunes to a number of items in their possession and falls {@condition unconscious} for a number of rounds equal to the amount of failed saves they made, starting from the lowest rarity item and onwards.

baseitem.name: Mystletainn
entries: {@italic This is the weapon of Mistel, modified to be used by Lancelot Laurent.}

Mystletainn is a beautiful sword. A blade crafted from the purest iron, purified through sanctimonious tradition and made holy by its divine connection to knighthood and the oaths to which Mistel's followers uphold. Having reached the apex of your power, Mistel has bestowed you a replica of her blade.

The mythos surrounding the blade grants it much Mystery, and its very design is the product of secrets that may never be discovered for as long as Mistel's knighthood reigns. Legends state the blade has the dormant power to multiply into two swords: Mystletainn and Misteltein. This is the power Lancelot Laurent has unlocked within the blade.
You gain a +2 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this magic weapon.

{@bold Knight of Mistel}. You are supernaturally aware of any aberrations, celestials, elementals, fey, fiends, and undead within 100-feet of you while attuned to Mystletainn. In addition, you cannot be possessed by creatures of those types.

{@bold The Second Blade}. As an object interaction while Mystletainn is drawn, you can manifest its second half in an adjacent hand: Misteltein. Misteltein is a greatsword that deals {@dice 2d6} slashing damage, and maintains the same properties as Mystletainn (including its +2 bonus to attack and damage rolls).

{@bold Divine Authority}. You have advantage on checks and saving throws made to inflict the {@condition charmed} or {@condition frightened} conditions while attuned to this weapon, and the spell {@spell command} automatically fails on you. In addition, if you enter your Grand Celestia form while attuned to this weapon, you gain truesight up to 30-feet.

{@bold Celestial Assertion}. You have been granted 6 mastery points as per your contract with Mistel, which you have access to while attuned to this weapon. You can spend a specified number of mastery points in order to activate any following abilities (assuming you meet their activation requirements). You regain all expended mastery points on a long rest.

rows: After attacking twice (once with Mystletainn and once with Misteltein), you can expend 2 mastery points to swipe your blades in an arc in front of you. Creatures of your choice within a 2x3 grid in front of you (with the middle column centered on you) must make a Dexterity saving throw with a DC equal to 8 + your Charisma modifier + your proficiency bonus. On a failed save, those creatures take {@dice 4d6} radiant damage and are {@condition blinded} until the end of their next turn.

When you take the attack action on your turn, you can expend 2 mastery points and attack with Misteltein as you lunge forward. On a hit, you deal {@dice 3d6} piercing damage (rather than slashing damage) to the target and any creatures of your choice in a 10-foot line behind it. In addition, you grant your attacks advantage until the end of your turn. If you already have advantage, your attacks instead gain an additional +2 to damage until the end of your next turn. Finally, the creature you hit cannot use their reaction to take attacks of opportunity against you until the end of their next turn.

Upon your first or third attack with Misteltein, you can expend 2 mastery points to tap into your divine connection with Mistel, drawing upon her strength as you ready yourself and your companions for battle. You and any creature you have bestowed your Boon of Knighthood upon heal for {@dice 2d10} hit points and gain {@dice 3d10} temporary hit points.
As a bonus action on your turn, you can expend a spell slot to gain a number of mastery points equal to its level (up to 3). You cannot increase your mastery points above 6 this way.

entries.name: Special
entries: You have disadvantage when you use Mystletainn to attack a target within 5 feet of you. Also, Mystletainn requires two hands to wield when you aren't mounted.

baseitem.name: Red Magnum
entries: {@italic This is the weapon of Krurm, modified to be used by Korth Axe.}

The Red Magnum was forged in the flames of Onios, using a modified dual-ingot casting which combines pigblood and demonsteel into a fortified union. It is said to be as strong as Krurm himself, and as durable as his signature weapon: Woebringer.

As a newly-forged weapon, its Mystery is low, but it more than makes up for that fact with its demonic power, granted to it by Krurm himself. As such, one could make the claim that Red Magnum has just as much Mystery as Krurm. Using the demonic energy in its barrel, one can fire Red Magnum using their own strength.
You gain a +2 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this magic weapon.
{@bold Demonic Energy Chamber}. When making a ranged attack with this weapon, you use your Strength modifier instead of your Dexterity modifier for the attack and damage rolls.

{@bold You Fear Me Now}. You are immune to the {@condition frightened} condition. In addition, when a creature attempts to frighten you, you can use a reaction to manifest your aura of intimidation, war, and defilement. Expend one use of your Guided by the God of War feature, and that creature must make a Wisdom saving throw with its DC. On a failed save, that creature becomes {@condition frightened} and their movement speed becomes 0, or have their speed reduced by half on a successful save. Fiends have disadvantage on this save, and creatures immune to the {@condition frightened} condition autopass this save.

{@bold Battle Planning}.You have a list of fiends who you have dominated on the fields of combat as part of the Blood War. When you take a long rest, you can select 3 creatures on your fiend list to add to your prepared list. You cannot swap out creatures from your prepared list until you finish another long rest.

{@bold Blood War}. You have trained in the heart of Onios, and have manifested 12 blood points as per your contract with Krurm. You can spend a number of blood points as an action on your turn to summon a number of fiends from your prepared list decided by you. The CR of the creatures you summon must add up to the amount of blood points you expend. You regain all expended blood points on a long rest.

entries.name: Ammunition
entries: You can use a weapon that has the ammunition property to make a ranged attack only if you have ammunition to fire from the weapon. Each time you attack with the weapon, you expend one piece of ammunition. Drawing the ammunition from a quiver, case, or other container is part of the attack. Loading a one-handed weapon requires a free hand. At the end of the battle, you can recover half your expended ammunition by taking a minute to search the battlefield.
If you use a weapon that has the ammunition property to make a melee attack, you treat the weapon as an improvised weapon. A sling must be loaded to deal any damage when used in this way.

entries.name: Ammunition
entries: You can use a weapon that has the ammunition property to make a ranged attack only if you have ammunition to fire from the weapon. Each time you attack with the weapon, you expend one piece of ammunition. Drawing the ammunition from a quiver, case, or other container is part of the attack. Loading a one-handed weapon requires a free hand. The ammunition of a firearm is destroyed upon use.
If you use a weapon that has the ammunition property to make a melee attack, you treat the weapon as an improvised weapon. A sling must be loaded to deal any damage when used in this way.

entries.name: Burst Fire
entries: A weapon that has the burst fire property can make a single-target attack, or it can spray a 10-foot-cube area within normal range with shots. Each creature in the area must succeed on a DC 15 Dexterity saving throw or take the weapon's normal damage. This saving throw changes depending on the stat you use to make your ranged firearm attacks. This action uses ten pieces of ammunition.

entries.name: Finesse
entries: When making an attack with a finesse weapon, you use your choice of your Strength or Dexterity modifier for the attack and damage rolls. You must use the same modifier for both rolls.

entries.name: Concealed
entries: This weapon is not immediately obvious, and may be easily hidden or disguised as something else. A person attempting to locate the presence of this weapon must succeed on an {@skill Investigation} check opposed by a {@skill Stealth} check on the part of the character with the weapon equipped. Attacks with this weapon against creatures aware of you yet unaware of the weapon's presence are made with advantage.

entries.name: Double Weapon
entries: A weapon with this property may be wielded as one weapon, or as two separate weapons both considered to be light. When wielded as one weapon, the weapon may still be one or two-handed, depending on its other properties. A weapon with this property lists to sets of damage die with it, the first for the main-hand of this weapon, the second for the off-hand, and damage on both sides of a double weapon are the same as if it were wielded as a single weapon. Held as a double weapon, one hand or the other may have additional properties, listed alongside their respective damage die. Properties on the weapon (aside from two-handed) apply to both halves of the double weapon, as well.

entries.name: Arisen Weapon
entries: So long as you remain bound to your Arisen, you are considered proficient in this weapon. If you ever are to become unbound to your Arisen, the weapon vanishes, and so do any benefits it gives.

No creature other than the bonded target may use or hold this weapon‚Äîthe action becomes physically impossible whenever attempted. In addition, you gain the ability to summon this weapon as a bonus action on your turn, causing it to instantly appear equipped onto your form and become attuned (if you have a free attunement slot).

entries.name: Grappling
entries: If a weapon has this property, an attack made with this weapon against an enemy in range of the weapon or within the weapon's reach may instead be made as a grapple. If the weapon carries the finesse property as well, the grapple may be made and maintained with a Dexterity check rather than an {@skill Athletics} check. If the weapon is ranged, the target's {@skill Athletics} or {@skill Acrobatics} checks to escape the grapple are made against a DC equal to 10 + your Strength modifier.

entries.name: Returning
entries: When a thrown weapon also carrying the returning property is thrown as part of an attack, it returns to its wielder immediately after the attack. When throwing a returning weapon, you can choose to not have it return in order to add 5 feet to its short range and 10 feet to its long range.

entries.name: Disarm Immune
entries: Any weapon that carries this property may not unwillingly be removed from your grasp while you remain conscious.

entries.name: Unarmed
entries: When you make an unarmed strike, you can choose to have the attack deal damage equal to the damage of this weapon, rather than your normal unarmed strike damage. In addition, your hands are considered free for the purposes of object interactions and grappling.

entries.name: Reload
entries: This weapon can be fired a number of times equal to its Reload score before you must spend 1 attack or 1 action to reload. You must have one free hand to reload a firearm.

entries.name: Misfire
entries: Whenever you make an attack roll with a firearm, and the die roll is equal to or lower than the weapon's Misfire score, the weapon misfires. The attack misses, and the weapon cannot be used again until you spend an action to try and repair it. To repair your firearm, you must make a successful {@item Tinker's tools|phb} check (DC equal to 8 + misfire score). If your check fails, the weapon is broken and must be mended out of combat at the quarter of a cost of a firearm. Creatures who use a firearm without being proficient increase the weapon's misfire score by 1.

entries.name: Ammo+
entries: This weapon requires advanced ammunition to fire, usually gunpowder, bullets, or magazines.

entries.name: Explosive
entries: On a hit, every creature within 5 feet of the target much make a Dexterity saving throw (DC equal to 8 + your proficiency bonus + your Dexterity modifier) or suffer {@dice 1d8} fire damage. If the weapon misses, the ammunition fails to detonate, or bounces away harmlessly before doing so. Explosive weapons will also damage terrain (if applicable).

entries.name: Automatic Weapon
entries: Automatic weapons have a unique reload system from other firearms, and as such, feats or class features that allow you to ignore the reload property do not work on automatic weapons.

entries.name: Rapid Fire
entries: As an attack action, you can make a special attack against one target creature within range. Choose an amount of ammunition (minimum of 2, up to 3) you wish to expend from your weapon and make a ranged weapon attack roll. The target takes {@dice 1d6} piercing damage per piece of ammunition expended, up to a maximum of {@dice 3d6}. You can only Rapid Fire a weapon once per turn.

entries.name: Automatic Fire
entries: As an attack action, you can make a special attack against creatures in a cone in front of you, with the cone's size equal to half the weapon's short range. Expend 6 pieces of ammunition. Creatures in that cone must make a Dexterity saving throw with a DC equal to 8 + your Dexterity modifier + your proficiency bonus. This saving throw changes depending on the stat you use to make your ranged firearm attacks. On a failed save, those creatures take {@dice 2d8} + your Dexterity modifier piercing damage, or half as much on a successful save.

entries.name: Scatter
entries: Whenever you make the attack action, as a bonus action, you can cause your firearm to hit multiple targets. Make an attack roll against each creature in a cone equal to your firearm's normal range. On a successful hit, those creatures suffer damage as if you had attacked each of them (roll once). Firing this way increases your misfire score by 2 for that attack. You can only use Scatter once per round, regardless of how many bonus actions you may have. The Scatter property is unaffected by the Sharpshooter feat.

entries.name: Heavy
entries: Small creatures have disadvantage on attack rolls with heavy weapons. A heavy weapon's size and bulk make it too large for a Small creature to use effectively.

entries.name: Light
entries: A light weapon is small and easy to handle, making it ideal for use when fighting with two weapons.

entries.name: Loading
entries: Because of the time required to load this weapon, you can fire only one piece of ammunition from it when you use an action, bonus action, or reaction to fire it, regardless of the number of attacks you can normally make.

entries.name: Reach
entries: This weapon adds 5 feet to your reach when you attack with it. This property also determines your reach for opportunity attacks with a reach weapon.

entries.name: Reload
entries: A limited number of shots can be made with a weapon that has the reload property. A character must then reload it using an action or a bonus action (the character's choice).

entries.name: Thrown
entries: If a weapon has the thrown property, you can throw the weapon to make a ranged attack. If the weapon is a melee weapon, you use the same ability modifier for that attack roll and damage roll that you would use for a melee attack with the weapon. For example, if you throw a handaxe, you use your Strength, but if you throw a dagger, you can use either your Strength or your Dexterity, since the dagger has the finesse property. When you make a ranged attack with a thrown weapon, you can choose to immediately draw one weapon as a part of that attack.

entries.name: Two-Handed
entries: This weapon requires two hands to use. This property is relevant only when you attack with the weapon, not when you simply hold it.

entries.name: Versatile
entries: This weapon can be used with one or two hands. A damage value in parentheses appears with the property—the damage when the weapon is used with two hands to make a melee attack.

itemType.name: Artisan's Tools
entries: These special tools include the items needed to pursue a craft or trade. Proficiency with a set of artisan's tools lets you add your proficiency bonus to any ability checks you make using the tools in your craft. Each type of artisan's tools requires a separate proficiency.

itemType.name: Gaming Set
entries: If you are proficient with a gaming set, you can add your proficiency bonus to ability checks you make to play a game with that set. Each type of gaming set requires a separate proficiency.

itemType.name: Instrument
entries: If you have proficiency with a given musical instrument, you can add your proficiency bonus to any ability checks you make to play music with the instrument.
A bard can use a musical instrument as a spellcasting focus, substituting it for any material component that does not list a cost.
Each type of musical instrument requires a separate proficiency.

entries.name: Range
entries: A weapon that can be used to make a ranged attack has a range shown in parentheses after the ammunition or thrown property. The range lists two numbers. The first is the weapon's normal range in feet, and the second indicates the weapon's maximum range. When attacking a target beyond normal range, you have disadvantage on the attack roll. You can't attack a target beyond the weapon's long range.

itemType.name: Trade Good
entries: Most wealth is not in coins. It is measured in livestock, grain, land, rights to collect taxes, or rights to resources (such as a mine or a forest).

Guilds, nobles, and royalty regulate trade. Chartered companies are granted rights to conduct trade along certain routes, to send merchant ships to various ports, or to buy or sell specific goods. Guilds set prices for the goods or services that they control, and determine who may or may not offer those goods and services. Merchants commonly exchange trade goods without using currency.

entries.name: Crew
entries: A ship needs a crew of skilled hirelings to function. As per the Player's Handbook, one skilled hireling costs at least 2 gp per day. The minimum number of skilled hirelings needed to crew a ship depends on the type of vessel.

You can track the loyalty of individual crew members or the crew as a whole using the optional loyalty rules in chapter 4 of the Dungeon Master's Guide. If at least half the crew becomes disloyal during a voyage, the crew turns hostile and stages a mutiny. If the ship is berthed, disloyal crew members leave the ship and never return.

entries.name: Passengers
entries: This indicates the number of Small and Medium passengers the ship can accommodate.
Accommodations consist of shared hammocks in tight quarters. A ship outfitted with private accommodations can carry one-fifth as many passengers.
A passenger is usually expected to pay 5 sp per day for a hammock, but prices can vary from ship to ship. A small private cabin usually costs 2 gp per day.

entries.name: Cargo
entries: The maximum tonnage the ship can carry.

entries.name: Damage Threshold
entries: If a ship has a Damage Threshold, it has immunity to all damage unless it takes an amount of damage equal to or greater than its damage threshold, in which case it takes damage as normal. Any damage that fails to meet or exceed the damage threshold is considered superficial and doesn't reduce the ship's hit points.

entries.name: Ship Repair
entries: Repairs to a damaged ship can be made while the vessel is berthed. Repairing 1 hit point of damage requires 1 day and costs 20 gp for materials and labor.
Proficiency with a musical instrument indicates you are familiar with the techniques used to play it. You also have knowledge of some songs commonly performed with that instrument.

entries.name: History
entries: Your expertise aids you in recalling lore related to your instrument.

entries.name: Performance
entries: Your ability to put on a good show is improved when you incorporate an instrument into your act.

entries.name: Compose a Tune
entries: As part of a long rest, you can compose a new tune and lyrics for your instrument. You might use this ability to impress a noble or spread scandalous rumors with a catchy tune.
Proficiency with a gaming set applies to one type of game, such as Three-Dragon Ante or games of chance that use dice.

entries.name: Components
entries: A gaming set has all the pieces needed to play a specific game or type of game, such as a complete deck of cards or a board and tokens.

entries.name: History
entries: Your mastery of a game includes knowledge of its history, as well as of important events it was connected to or prominent historical figures involved with it.

entries.name: Insight
entries: Playing games with someone is a good way to gain understanding of their personality, granting you a better ability to discern their lies from their truths and read their mood.

entries.name: Sleight of Hand
entries: Sleight of Hand is a useful skill for cheating at a game, as it allows you to swap pieces, palm cards, or alter a die roll. Alternatively, engrossing a target in a game by manipulating the components with dexterous movements is a great distraction for a pickpocketing attempt.

entries.caption: Gaming Set
rows: Gain insight into an opponent's personality
